en: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt (every man and his household came with Jacob):
hmr: Hieng hi Jakob ruola Aiguptaa hung thla Israel naupasalhai hming chu an nih, mi tin a sûnghai pei leh:

en: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
hmr: Reuben, Simeon, Levi le Juda,

en: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
hmr: Issakar, Zebulun le Benjamin,

en: Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
hmr: Dan le Naphtali, Gad le Aser hi.

en: And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: and Joseph was in Egypt already.
hmr: Jakob ṭhalbea inthawka suok- hai po chu mi sâwmsari an nih; Josef ruok chu Aiguptaah a lo um ta hrim a.

en: And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.
hmr: Chun, Josef le a unauhai po le, chu ṭhanga mi po chu an thi tah a.

en: And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Israel thlahai chu an hung sûngruol a, tamtaka hung inbelsain an hung pung a, nasataka thilthawtheiin an hung um a; ram chu anni hluo sipin a um tah a.

en: Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who knew not Joseph.
hmr: Tuhin Aiguptaa chun Josef hre ngailo lal thar a hung inlal tah a.

en: And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we:
hmr: A mihai kuoma chun, “En ta u, Israel thlahai hi eini nêkin an tam hlein thil an thaw thei lem bêk a;

en: come, let us deal wisely with them, lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they also join themselves unto our enemies, and fight against us, and get them up out of the land.
hmr: hung ro, anni hi vartakin sawisâng ei tiu; chuong naw chun hung pung an ta; indona ieng khawm a hung suok pha, anni hin ei hmêlmahai chu ṭhangpuiin mi do an ta, hi rama inthawk hi tlân suok rawi an tih,” a tih a.

en: Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh store-cities, Pithom and Raamses.
hmr: Chuleiin, phurrik takhaia anni sukrinum dingin, an chungah sin- thawhotuhai an siempêk ta ngei a. Chun, Pithom le Rameses, sie- khâwmna khawpuihai chu, Pharao ta dingin an bâwl tah a.

en: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and the more they spread abroad. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm anni chu an sukrimsi po leh an pung zuol deu deuin, an indar lien deu deu lem tah a. Chun, Aigupta mihai chun Israel thlahai chu an ṭithâwng hle el tah a.

en: And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigor:
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel thlahai chu inrimtakin sin an inthawtir a;

en: and they made their lives bitter with hard service, in mortar and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field, all their service, wherein they made them serve with rigor.
hmr: an sinthaw po po, lo sin kawng tinrênga le lung rawtnawinaa le ṭêklei siemnaa sin intaktakhai chu rimsitaka inthawtirin an nunhai an sukrinumpêk tah a.

en: And the king of Egypt spake to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah:
hmr: Chun, Aigupta lal chun Hebrai naudawmtuhai kuoma chun thu a hril tah a; chuhai pakhat hming chu Siphra, a dang hming chu Pua a nih;

en: and he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the birth-stool; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him; but if it be a daughter, then she shall live.
hmr: ama chun, “Hebrai nuhmeihai kuoma naudawmtu sin in va thawha, nau piengna hmun ngeia in va hmu pha; naupasal an ni chun that unla, naunuhmei a ni ruok chun a hringin hla ro,” a tih a.

en: But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the men-children alive.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, naudawmtu- hai chun Pathien an ṭih a, Aigupta lalin anni thu a pêk angin an thaw nawh a, nautê pasalhai chu an sanhim lem tah a.

en: And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men-children alive?
hmr: Chun, Aigupta lal chun nau- dawmtuhai chu a ko a, an kuomah, “Iengdinga hi thil hi in thawh a, naupasalhai chu a hringa hla am in nih a?” a tih a.

en: And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwife come unto them.
hmr: Naudawmtuhai chun Pharao kuomah, “Hebrai nuhmeihai chu Aigupta nuhmeihai ang an ni nawh a, anni chu an hrisêl a, naudawmtuhai an kuom an tlung hma hin nau chu an lo nei ta hlak a nih,” an tih a.

en: And God dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.
hmr: Pathienin naudawmtuhai chu ṭhatakin a ngaisak a; Hebrai mihai chu an hung pung a, thilthawtheitak an hung ni tah a.

en: And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them households.
hmr: Naudawmtuhai chun Pathien an ṭi leiin Pathienin sûngkuoahai a siem tah a.

en: And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun, “Naupasal hung pieng taphawt chu vadungah pei unla, naunuhmei taphawt chu a hringin hla ro,” tiin a mihai chu thu a pêk tlat a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh: for I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants, that I may show these my signs in the midst of them,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Pharao kuomah va lût la, hieng ka inchiknahai hi anni lai ngeia kân entir theina dingin a siehlawhai le ama lungril ngei khawm chu ka sukngar tah a nih;

en: and that thou mayest tell in the ears of thy son, and of thy son’s son, what things I have wrought upon Egypt, and my signs which I have done among them; that ye may know that I am Jehovah.
hmr: anni lai ngeia inchikna ka thawhai le, Aigupta mihai chu ieng angin am an chungah thil ka thawha ti i naupa le i tupa hrieta ngei khawm i hril theina dingin le; LALPA chu ka ni ngei ti i hriet theina dingin, ti rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and said unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, How long wilt thou refuse to humble thyself before me? let my people go, that they may serve me.
hmr: Chun, Mosie le Aron chu Pharao kuomah an va lût a, a kuomah, “Hebraihai Pathien LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ‘Ka hmaa insiehnuoi ieng chen am i nuom naw ding a nih a? Ka rawng an bâwl theina dingin ka mihai chu infetir rawh.

en: Else, if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, to-morrow will I bring locusts into thy border:
hmr: Ka mihai în fetir phal naw chun, ngai rawh, i ram sûngah, zinga leh khâuhai hung ṭhuoi ka ta;

en: and they shall cover the face of the earth, so that one shall not be able to see the earth: and they shall eat the residue of that which is escaped, which remaineth unto you from the hail, and shall eat every tree which groweth for you out of the field:
hmr: hnuoi chung po po chu a dâpin hung dâp an ta, hnuoi chu mi hmu theilo khawp hielin um a tih. Riel isuksietnaa i la chang a mahla la umhai chu fa vawng an ta, i ta dinga loa thing mâwng tinrênghai khawm chu fa vawng bawk an tih.

en: and thy houses shall be filled, and the houses of all thy servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians; as neither thy fathers nor thy fathers’ fathers have seen, since the day that they were upon the earth unto this day. And he turned, and went out from Pharaoh.
hmr: I inhai le i siehlaw po po inhai le Aigupta mi po po inhai chu sip vawng an ta, i pahai le i thlatuhai khawmin, hi hnuoi chunga an uma inthawk vawisûn ni chen hin chuong ang chu la hmu ngai naw bawk an tih,’ a tih,” a tih a. Chun ân her a, Pharao kuoma inthawk chun a fe suok tah a.

en: And Pharaoh’s servants said unto him, How long shall this man be a snare unto us? let the men go, that they may serve Jehovah their God: knowest thou not yet that Egypt is destroyed?
hmr: Chun, Pharao siehlawhai chun a kuomah, “Hi mipa hi ei ta dingin ieng chen am châng a ni ding a ni leh? An Pathien LALPA chu a rawng an bâwlpêk theina dingin mihai chu infetir ta la: Aigupta hi suksiet vawng a ni tah ti hi i la hriet naw rawp am a nih?” an tih a.

en: And Moses and Aaron were brought again unto Pharaoh: and he said unto them, Go, serve Jehovah your God; but who are they that shall go?
hmr: Chun, Mosie le Aron chu Pharao kuomah an hung ṭhuoi nâwk a, ama chun an kuomah, “Fe unla, in Pathien LALPA rawng chu va bâwl ro le; amiruokchu, a fe ding chu tu tuhai am an nih a?” a tih a.

en: And Moses said, We will go with our young and with our old; with our sons and with our daughters, with our flocks and with our herds will we go; for we must hold a feast unto Jehovah.
hmr: Mosie chun, “LALPA kuoma chun ruoi kan ṭhe ding a ni sih a, kan naupanghai le kan tarhai leh, kan naupasalhai kan naunuhmeihai leh, kan bâwng ruolhai le kan berâm ruolhai leh fêng kan tih,” a tih a.

en: And he said unto them, So be Jehovah with you, as I will let you go, and your little ones: look to it; for evil is before you.
hmr: Pharao chun, “LALPA chu in kuomah um raw se; nangni le in nauhai le chu kân fetir tâk cheu leh! En ta u, thiltum ṭhanawtak in nei a ni hi.

en: Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve Jehovah; for that is what ye desire. And they were driven out from Pharaoh’s presence.
hmr: Chuong chu ni thei naw nih, mi puitling bak va fe unla, LALPA rawng chu va bâwl ro: chu chu in nuomtak a ni sih a,” a tih a. Chun, Pharao hmaha inthawk chun hnawt hmangin an um tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come up upon the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail hath left.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Mosie kuom- ah, “Khâuhai hungna dingin Aigupta ram chungah i bân phar rawh; Aigupta rama an hung a, a rama hna hring tinrêng, rielin a suksiet mahla chu an fâk vawngna dingin,” a tih a.

en: And Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt, and Jehovah brought an east wind upon the land all that day, and all the night; and when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
hmr: Chuongchun, Mosie chun Aigupta ram chunga chun a hmawl chu ân let tah a; chun, LALPA chun chu ni sûnnithlak le zânkhawvârin ram chunga chun sak thli ân hrângtir a; chun, zîngtieng a hung ni chun, sak thli chun khâuhai chu a hung lên tah a.

en: And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt, and rested in all the borders of Egypt; very grievous were they; before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them shall be such.
hmr: Khâuhai chu Aigupta ram po po chunga chun an hung a, Aigupta ram sûng po poa chun an um khup el tah a; a râpthlâk bêk a, anni hma hin anni ang hrim hin khau an la um ngai nawh a, anni hnunga khawm um ngai ta bawk nawng an tih.

en: For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they did eat every herb of the land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left: and there remained not any green thing, either tree or herb of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
hmr: A ram pumpui chu an dâp khup el sih a, ram chu ân thim khup el bawk a; rama hna hring tinrêng le, thing rahai, riel ihlahai chu an fâk ta ngei a; Aigupta ram pumpuia chun loa thlaihna, thing le thil a hring hrim a um ta dêr nawh a.

en: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste; and he said, I have sinned against Jehovah your God, and against you.
hmr: Chun Pharao chun Mosie le Aron chu inhmawtakin a ko a, “Nang le in Pathien LALPA chunga chun thil ka suksuol tah a nih.

en: Now therefore forgive, I pray thee, my sin only this once, and entreat Jehovah your God, that he may take away from me this death only.
hmr: Tuhin ka ngên che hi, ka suol hi vawikhat bak mi ngaidam nâwk phawt la, hi thina hi keimaa in- thawka a lâkhmang theina dingin LALPA chu mi hnipêk rawh,” a tih a.

en: And he went out from Pharaoh, and entreated Jehovah.
hmr: Pharao kuoma inthawk chu a fe suok a, LALPA chu a hni tah a.

en: And Jehovah turned an exceeding strong west wind, which took up the locusts, and drove them into the Red Sea; there remained not one locust in all the border of Egypt.
hmr: LALPA chun khâuhai po po chu lêna, Tuipui Sena khal lût vawngtu, thlang tieng thli hrâttak el chu ân hrângtir tah a, Aigupta ram po poa chun khâu pakhat khawm a um ta nawh a.

en: But Jehovah hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA chun Pharao lungril chu a sukngar a, Israel thlahai chu ân fetir chuong nawh.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Stretch out thy hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Aigupta ram chunga inthimna, in- maia inmaina khawp hielin inthimna a hung um theina dingin i bân phar rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven; and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days;
hmr: Chun, Mosie chun vân tieng a bân a phar a; chuongchun, ni thum sûng chu Aigupta ram sûng po poa chun inthim sa mup el chu a um tah a;

en: they saw not one another, neither rose any one from his place for three days: but all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
hmr: chu ni thum sûng chun tu- khawm an hmuna inthawkin an suok nawh a, inhmu khawm an inhmutuo thei bawk nawh; Israel thlahai po ruok chun an umnahaia chun var an nei seng a.

en: And Pharaoh called unto Moses, and said, Go ye, serve Jehovah; only let your flocks and your herds be stayed: let your little ones also go with you.
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun Mosie a ko a, “Fe unla, LALPA rawng chu va bâwl ro; in nauhai khawm in ruolin fe ve hai sienla, in berâm ruolhai le in bâwng ruolhai ruok chu mâksan ro,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said, Thou must also give into our hand sacrifices and burnt-offerings, that we may sacrifice unto Jehovah our God.
hmr: Mosie ruok chun, “Kan Pathien LALPA kuoma kan inthâwi theina dingin, pumrawhmang thilinhlân dinghai le inthâwina dinghai chu kan kutah i mi pêk ding a nih.

en: Our cattle also shall go with us; there shall not a hoof be left behind: for thereof must we take to serve Jehovah our God; and we know not with what we must serve Jehovah, until we come thither.
hmr: Kan ran ruolhai khawm keini leh an fe ve ding a nih, ran tê pakhat khawm mâksan an ni ding a ni nawh a; kan Pathien LALPA rawng kan bâwlna dingin kan ṭhuoi ve ngei ding a nih; a hmun kan tlung hmakhat chu ieng hmangin am LALPA rawng chu kan bâwl ding a nih ti kan hriet si nawh a,” a tih a.

en: But Jehovah hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pharao lungril chu LALPAIN a sukngar a, anni chu ân fetir chuong nawh a.

en: And Pharaoh said unto him, Get thee from me, take heed to thyself, see my face no more; for in the day thou seest my face thou shalt die.
hmr: Pharao chun a kuomah, “Ka kuoma inthawkin fe hmang la, ka hmêl hrim hrim hung hmu nâwk ta lo dingin fîmkhur rawh, ka hmêl i hmu nâwk ni ni chun i thi ngei ding a ni sih a,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said, Thou hast spoken well; I will see thy face again no more.
hmr: Mosie chun, “I ti ṭha ngawt el ie, i hmêl hmu nâwk hrim hrim ta naw ning,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Yet one plague more will I bring upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt; afterwards he will let you go hence: when he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out hence altogether.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Pharao le Aigupta chungah hri pakhat la hung intlungtir nâwk ka tih, chu hnunga chun hitaka inthawk hin infetir a ti cheu. Ân fetir pha cheu chun a namin nam suok fai vawng a ti cheu.

en: Speak now in the ears of the people, and let them ask every man of his neighbor, and every woman of her neighbor, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold.
hmr: Mipuihai hrieta chun hril la, pasal tin le nuhmei tinin, rângkachak le tangkaruo incheinahai an tuol- bâwmhaia inthawkin haw seng raw hai se,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh’s servants, and in the sight of the people.
hmr: LALPA chun Aiguptahai mit- hmuah Israel mihai chu ditsakna ân hmutir a, Mosie ngei khawm chu mipui mithmu le Pharao siehlawhai mithmuah Aigupta ram sûnga chun mi lientak a ni bawk a.

en: And Moses said, Thus saith Jehovah, About midnight will I go out into the midst of Egypt:
hmr: Mosie chun, “Hieng ang hin LALPAIN a tih: ‘Zân ril lai vêlah Aigupta mihai lai fe suok ka ta;

en: and all the first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh that sitteth upon his throne, even unto the first-born of the maid-servant that is behind the mill; and all the first-born of cattle.
hmr: Aigupta rama nau lutîr po po, Pharao nau lutîr a lalṭhungphaa ṭhunga inthawka, bu râwtnawinaa sinthaw suoknu nau lutîr tak chen le, ran ruol tê hmasatakhai le chun thi fai vawng an tih.

en: And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there hath not been, nor shall be any more.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta ram sûng po poa chun ṭap nasatak um a tih: chuong ang hrim hrim chu a la um ngai dêr nawh a, um khawm um nâwk ta dêr bawk naw ni.

en: But against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog move his tongue, against man or beast: that ye may know how that Jehovah doth make a distinction between the Egyptians and Israel.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Israel mihai le Aigupta mihai kâra chun LALPAIN ieng ang lâwma danglamna am a sie ti in hriet theina dingin, Israel thlahai laia chu ran le mihriem khawm ui khawmin inngak naw ni.

en: And all these thy servants shall come down unto me, and bow down themselves unto me, saying, Get thee out, and all the people that follow thee: and after that I will go out. And he went out from Pharaoh in hot anger.
hmr: Chun, hieng i siehlawhai po po hi ka kuomah hung an ta, ka hmaa bawkkhupin, Nanga zuitu dinghai po po le chun suok ta rawh,’ mi tîng an tih; chun, chu hnunga chun suok tâng ka tih, tiin,” a tih a. Pharao kuoma inthawk chun lunginsentakin a suok tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Pharaoh will not hearken unto you; that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun LALPAIN Mosie kuomah, “Aigupta rama hin ka thilmakhai sukpung a ni theina dingin, Pharao chun in thu a ngai naw ding a ni hi,” a tih a.

en: And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: and Jehovah hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go out of his land.
hmr: Mosie le Aron chun Pharao hmaa chun thilmakhai po po chu an thaw tah a; nisienlakhawm, LALPA chun Pharao lungril chu a sukngar a, Israel thlahai chu a rama inthawk ân fe suoktir chuong nawh a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,
hmr: Aigupta rama chun LALPAIN Mosie le Aron kuoma chun a hril a,

en: This month shall be unto you the beginning of months: it shall be the first month of the year to you.
hmr: “Hi thla hi in ta dingin thla inṭanna ning a ta, in ta dingin kum khata thla hmasatak ning a tih.

en: Speak ye unto all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth day of this month they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to their fathers’ houses, a lamb for a household:
hmr: Israel mi inkhâwmhai po po lai chun hril unla, ‘hi thla ni sâwm ni tak hin, mi tinin an pahnamhai ang peiin berâmte pakhat, sûng khat ta dingin berâmte pakhat la seng raw hai se:

en: and if the household be too little for a lamb, then shall he and his neighbor next unto his house take one according to the number of the souls; according to every man’s eating ye shall make your count for the lamb.
hmr: chun, sûng khat chu berâmte pakhat ta dinga an tlâwm talaw chun ama le a dawttu chun berâmte pa- khat, a mi tamzie ang peiin hmang an ta, mi tin ifâk tâwk ang peiin berâmte chu tiem in tih.

en: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male a year old: ye shall take it from the sheep, or from the goats:
hmr: In berâmte chu a chal kum khat mi, demkailo a ni ding a nih, kêl ruol laia inthawkin, annawleh, berâm ruol laia inthawkin la tum in tih,

en: and ye shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month; and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at even.
hmr: chu thla ni sâwm pali chen chun kawl in tih: Israel mi inkhâwmhai po po chun zântieng chun that in tih.

en: And they shall take of the blood, and put it on the two side-posts and on the lintel, upon the houses wherein they shall eat it.
hmr: Chun, a thisen chu lâng an ta, an fâkna ding in kawtkhâr bieng ve ve le kawtkhâr lu khang pheiah nâl an tih.

en: And they shall eat the flesh in that night, roast with fire, and unleavened bread; with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
hmr: Chu zân chun a sa chu meia rawin, chawl ṭhanglo bei leh fâng an ta; hlohna kha leh fâng an tih.

en: Eat not of it raw, nor boiled at all with water, but roast with fire; its head with its legs and with the inwards thereof.
hmr: A selin amanih, tuia suongin amanih fa naw unla, em hmin lem ro; a lu le a kehai le a sûnghai le chun.

en: And ye shall let nothing of it remain until the morning; but that which remaineth of it until the morning ye shall burn with fire.
hmr: Zîngkâr chena dingin a ieng- khawm in hla ding a ni nawh; zîngkâr chena um zing taphawt chu meiin raw hmang in tih.

en: And thus shall ye eat it: with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste: it is Jehovah’s passover.
hmr: Chun, hieng ang hin fâng in tih: in dier kei sa zingin, in kekawk bun sa zingin le, in kuta in hmawl chawi sa zingin, inhmâwtakin in fâk ding a nih. LALPA Fekân Ruoiṭhe a nih.

en: For I will go through the land of Egypt in that night, and will smite all the first-born in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgments: I am Jehovah.
hmr: Chu zân chun Aigupta ram fe thleng ka ta, ran le mihriem khawm, Aigupta rama nau lutîr po po chu ka sukhlum ding a ni sih a; chun, Aigupta mihai pathienhai chunga khawm rorêlnahai intlungtir bawk ka tih, LALPA chu ka ni hi!

en: And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where ye are: and when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and there shall no plague be upon you to destroy you, when I smite the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, thisen chu in ta dingin in umna inhai inchikna nîng a ta; thisen chu ka hmu pha chun, nangni chu fekân ka ti cheu a, Aigupta ram ka hung hrem lai khawm chun, nangni sukbohmang ding cheuin in chungah hri hrim hrim um naw nih.

en: And this day shall be unto you for a memorial, and ye shall keep it a feast to Jehovah: throughout your generations ye shall keep it a feast by an ordinance for ever.
hmr: Hi ni hi in ta dingin hriet zingna nîng a ta, LALPA kuomah ruoiṭhena nei hlak in tih: in thlahai chenin, kumkhuoin dân angin hi ruoiṭhena hi nei zing in tih.

en: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.
hmr: Ni sari sûng chu chawl ṭhanglo bei in fâk ding a na, ni khat niha inthawk khawmin in inhaia in- thawkin chawl sie hmang vawng in ta; ni khat niha inthawka ni sari ni chen chun mi tukhawmin chawl ṭhang bei a fâk chun, chu mi chu Israel mihaia inthawka sâtthlâk a ni ding a ni sih a.

en: And in the first day there shall be to you a holy convocation, and in the seventh day a holy convocation; no manner of work shall be done in them, save that which every man must eat, that only may be done by you.
hmr: Ni khat ni chun in ta dingin inkhâwmpui inthieng um a ta, ni sari ni khawmin inkhâwmpui inthieng um bawk a tih; chuong nihaia chun sin iengkhawm in thaw ding a ni nawh, mi tinin fâk rawngbâwl ruok chu thaw thei in tih.

en: And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this selfsame day have I brought your hosts out of the land of Egypt: therefore shall ye observe this day throughout your generations by an ordinance for ever.
hmr: Chawl ṭhanglo bei ruoiṭhe chu inser in ta, chu ni le le chun in mihai chu Aigupta rama inthawkin ka ṭhuoi suok a ni sih a; chuleiin, kumkhaw dâna neiin, hi ni hi in thlahai chenin inser in tih.

en: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at even, ye shall eat unleavened bread, until the one and twentieth day of the month at even.
hmr: Thla hmasatakah, chu thla ni sâwm le pali ni zântiengah chawl ṭhanglo bei in fâk ding a nih, chu thla ma ni sâwm hni pakhat ni zântieng chenin.

en: Seven days shall there be no leaven found in your houses: for whosoever eateth that which is leavened, that soul shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he be a sojourner, or one that is born in the land.
hmr: Ni sari sûng chu chawl hrim hrim in inhaiah hmu a ni ding a ni nawh: mi tukhawm chawl ṭhang bei fatu chu, mikhuol khawm, a rama pieng khawm, chu mi chu Israel mi- puihai laia inthawka sât thlâk nîng a tih.

en: Ye shall eat nothing leavened; in all your habitations shall ye eat unleavened bread.
hmr: Chawl ṭhang hrim hrim chu iengkhawm in fâk ding a ni nawh; in umna taphawthaia chun chawl ṭhanglo bei in fâk ding a nih,’ tiin hril rawh,” tiin.

en: Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said unto them, Draw out, and take you lambs according to your families, and kill the passover.
hmr: Chun Mosie chun Israel upahai po po chu a ko khâwm a, an kuomah, “Fe suok unla, in sûngkaw tamzie ang peiin berâmte la unla, fekân ruoi dingin that ro.

en: And ye shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two side-posts with the blood that is in the basin; and none of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.
hmr: Hussop bâwr la unla, thlênga thisena chun inchie unla, chu thlênga thisen chun kawtkhâr bieng pahnihai le kawtkhâr lu chung khangphei chu nâl ro: chun, zîngkâr a ni hmakhat chu tukhawm a in kawtkhâra chun suok hlek naw raw se.

en: For Jehovah will pass through to smite the Egyptians; and when he seeth the blood upon the lintel, and on the two side-posts, Jehovah will pass over the door, and will not suffer the destroyer to come in unto your houses to smite you.
hmr: Aigupta mihai chu hrem dingin LALPA chu a fe thleng ding a ni sih a; chun, kawtkhâr bieng pahni le kawtkhâr lu chung khangpheia thi- sen chu a hmu chun, LALPA chun kawtkhâr chu fe kân a ta, in inhaia chun nangni sukhlum ding cheuin sukbohmangtu chu inhungtir naw nih.

en: And ye shall observe this thing for an ordinance to thee and to thy sons for ever.
hmr: Hi thil hi dâna neiin nangni le in thlahai chenin kumkhuoin inser in tih.

en: And it shall come to pass, when ye are come to the land which Jehovah will give you, according as he hath promised, that ye shall keep this service.
hmr: Chun, a thutiem anga, LALPA- IN ram a pêk ding cheu in tlung pha khawm, hi rawngbâwlna sin hi in vawn zing ding a nih.

en: And it shall come to pass, when your children shall say unto you, What mean ye by this service?
hmr: Chun, in nauhaiin, ‘Hi rawng- bâwlna hi a umzie ieng am a na?’ an ti pha cheu chun,

en: that ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of Jehovah’s passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshipped.
hmr: ‘Aigupta mihai a sukhlum a, ei inhai a sanhim laia, Aigupta rama Israel thlahai inhai fekântu, LALPA Fekân inthawina chu a nih,’ tîng in tih,” a tih a. Mipui chun an lu an suk a, chibai an bûk tah a.

en: And the children of Israel went and did so; as Jehovah had commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chu an feh a, LALPAIN Mosie le Aron thu a pêk ang ngei chun an thaw tah a.

en: And it came to pass at midnight, that Jehovah smote all the first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh that sat on his throne unto the first-born of the captive that was in the dungeon; and all the first-born of cattle.
hmr: Zânril lai takah LALPA chun Aigupta rama nau lutîr po po, Pharao nau lutîr a lalṭhungphaa ṭhunga inthawka sal lung ina intâng nau lutîr chen le, ran ruol tê hmasatakhai chen chun a hung sukhlum ta vawng a.

en: And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt; for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
hmr: Zâna chun Pharao le a sie- hlawhai le Aigupta mi po pohai chu an tho a, Aiguptaa chun ṭap nasatak el chu a um tah a: in tin el chu mithi um nawna hrim a um si nawh a.

en: And he called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, Rise up, get you forth from among my people, both ye and the children of Israel; and go, serve Jehovah, as ye have said.
hmr: Azân azânin Mosie le Aron chu a ko a, “Tho unla, Israel thlahai le chun ka mihaia inthawkin fe hmang dai ro; chuongchun, fe unla, in ti ta angin LALPA rawng chu va bâwl ro.

en: Take both your flocks and your herds, as ye have said, and be gone; and bless me also.
hmr: In ti ta angin in bâwng ruolhai le in berâm ruolhai chu ṭhuoi unla, fe vak ro khai; chun, kei khawm mal mi sâwmpêk bawk unla,” a tih a.

en: And the Egyptians were urgent upon the people, to send them out of the land in haste; for they said, We are all dead men.
hmr: Aigupta mihai chun Israel mihai chu inhmâwtaka suok dingin an nawr sek sek a, “Ei thi zo vawng ding an ta hi,” an ti leiin.

en: And the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading-troughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel mihai chu an bei hmetna thlênghai chu puona tuoma an liengkohaia putin an beihai chu chawl phul loin an chawi tah a.

en: And the children of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they asked of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment:
hmr: Israel thlahai chun Mosie thu ang pei chun an thawh a; Aigupta mihai chu silfên le, rângkachak le tangkaraw incheinahai an hni tâwl a;

en: and Jehovah gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they let them have what they asked. And they despoiled the Egyptians.
hmr: chuongchun, LALPAIN Israel mihai chu Aigupta mihai mithmua chun ditsakna ân hmutir a, an hni taphawt chu an pêk pei el a. Chuong ang chun Aigupta mihai chu an suksiet tah a.

en: And the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand on foot that were men, besides children.
hmr: Israel thlahai, naupangnawi tiem loa puitling ruok khawm nuoi ruk lai chu Ramesesa inthawkin Sukkoth chen kein an fe tah a.

en: And a mixed multitude went up also with them; and flocks, and herds, even very much cattle.
hmr: Mi chilak tamtak khawm anni leh an hang fe veh a; bâwng ruol le berâm ruol le ran ruol tamtak leh.

en: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt; for it was not leavened, because they were thrust out of Egypt, and could not tarry, neither had they prepared for themselves any victuals.
hmr: Aiguptaa inthawka beihlawm an hung chawihai chu chawl ṭhanglo beiphêkhaiah an zeu a, chawl ṭhanglo a ni hrim a; Aiguptaa inthawk a nama nam suok el an ni leiin le an muong thei ta naw leiin fâk ding iengkhawm an inbuotsai si nawh a.

en: Now the time that the children of Israel dwelt in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.
hmr: Israel thlahai thang sung, Aiguptaa an thang sung chu kum za li sawmthum a nih.

en: And it came to pass at the end of four hundred and thirty years, even the selfsame day it came to pass, that all the hosts of Jehovah went out from the land of Egypt.
hmr: Kum za li le sawmthum tâwpah, chu ni le le chun LALPA mipuihai chu Aigupta rama inthawkin an fe suok tah a.

en: It is a night to be much observed unto Jehovah for bringing them out from the land of Egypt: this is that night of Jehovah, to be much observed of all the children of Israel throughout their generations.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka ṭhuoi suok dinga LALPAIN a vêng tlat zân chu a nih: chu zân chu a nih Israel thlahaiin an thlahai nâwksâwng chen khawma LALPA ta dinga an inser tlat ding chu.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses and Aaron, This is the ordinance of the passover: there shall no foreigner eat thereof;
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie le Aron kuomah, “Fekân Ruoi dân ding chu hi hi a nih: ram dang mi chun a fâk ve ding a ni nawh:

en: but every man’s servant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat thereof.
hmr: amiruokchu, siehlaw tukhawm tangka suma inchâwk tah, ama chu sertanpêk tah a ni bawk chun fa vêng a tih.

en: A sojourner and a hired servant shall not eat thereof.
hmr: Khuolchâm amanih, inhlawfa siehlaw tukhawmin chu chu fa thei naw nih.

en: In one house shall it be eaten; thou shalt not carry forth aught of the flesh abroad out of the house; neither shall ye break a bone thereof.
hmr: In khata fâk ding a nih a, a sa a iengkhawm tuolah in chawi dawk ding a ni nawh, a ru khawm in sukthliek hlek ding a ni nawh.

en: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
hmr: Israel mipuihai chun hi hi an zâwm tlat ding a nih.

en: And when a stranger shall sojourn with thee, and will keep the passover to Jehovah, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as one that is born in the land: but no uncircumcised person shall eat thereof.
hmr: Hnam dang mi nang le fe ve a um a, LALPA kuoma Fekân Ruoi a hmang ve ding chun, pasalhai po chu an ser intantir la, chun, hung hnai sienla, hmang raw se: chun ama chu chu rama pieng ang bawk chu nîng a tih, a ram mi hrim ang nîng a tih. Sertanlo mi ruok chun, chu chu a fâk ding a ni nawh.

en: One law shall be to him that is home-born, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among you.
hmr: A ram mi hrim le hnam dang mi nangni laia khuolchâm ta ding khawmin dân pakhat chau a um,” a tih a.

en: Thus did all the children of Israel; as Jehovah commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
hmr: Hieng ang hin Israel thlahai po po chun an thawh a; LALPAIN Mosie le Aron thu a pêk ang ngeiin an thawh a.

en: And it came to pass the selfsame day, that Jehovah did bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their hosts.
hmr: Chu ni ngei chun LALPA chun Israel thlahai chu an pâwl ruol ang peiin Aigupta rama inthawk a ṭhuoi suok tah a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
hmr: Chun LALPA chun Mosie kuomah a hril a,

en: Sanctify unto me all the first-born, whatsoever openeth the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and of beast: it is mine.
hmr: “Israel thlahai laia nau lutîr sul hung kêu taphawt, mihriem khawm, ran khawm ka kuomah hung inhlân vawng rawh: ka ta a nih,” tiin.

en: And Moses said unto the people, Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand Jehovah brought you out from this place: there shall no leavened bread be eaten.
hmr: Mosie chun mipui kuoma chun, “Suoka in umna Aiguptaa inthawk in hung suok ni kha hre zing ro: LALPAIN kut thahrâtin chu hmuna inthawk chu a hung ṭhuoi suok cheu a ni kha; chawl ṭhang bei hrim fâk a ni ding a ni nawh.

en: This day ye go forth in the month Abib.
hmr: Abib thla, hi ni hin in fe suok a ni hi.

en: And it shall be, when Jehovah shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Amorite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, that thou shalt keep this service in this month.
hmr: LALPAIN Kanaan mihai, Hit mihai, Amor mihai, Hiv mihai le Jebus mihai ram, in thlatuhai kuoma pêk ding cheua a itiem, khuoizu le nênetuia luong rama a ṭhuoi lût pha cheu chun hi thlaa bawk hin hi rawngbâwlna hunbi hi in hmang ding a nih.

en: Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, and in the seventh day shall be a feast to Jehovah.
hmr: Ni sari sûng chawl ṭhanglo bei fâng in ta, a ni sari ni chun LALPA kuomah ruoi ṭhêng in tih.

en: Unleavened bread shall be eaten throughout the seven days; and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen with thee, in all thy borders.
hmr: Ni sari sûng chu chawl ṭhang- lo bei fâk ding a nih a; chun, in kuoma hrim hrim chawl ṭhang bei hmu a ni ding a ni nawh a, in ram sûng po po le nangni kuoma khawm chawl hrim hrim hmu a ni ding a ni nawh.

en: And thou shalt tell thy son in that day, saying, It is because of that which Jehovah did for me when I came forth out of Egypt.
hmr: Chu ni chun i naupa kuomah, ‘Aiguptaa inthawka ka hung suok laia LALPA thil mi thawpêk ta leia thaw a nih,’ tiin hril i tih.

en: And it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thy hand, and for a memorial between thine eyes, that the law of Jehovah may be in thy mouth: for with a strong hand hath Jehovah brought thee out of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, LALPA Dân chu i baua a um theina dingin, i mithai kâra hriet zingna ding le, i kuthai chunga nangma ta dinga inchikna dingin nîng a tih; LALPA chun kut thahrâtin Aiguptaa inthawkin a ṭhuoi suok ta si cheh a.

en: Thou shalt therefore keep this ordinance in its season from year to year.
hmr: Chuleiin, kum tinin hi hi a hun peiah dân angin i hmang ding a nih.”

en: And it shall be, when Jehovah shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, as he sware unto thee and to thy fathers, and shall give it thee,
hmr: Chun i thlatuhai le nanga kuoma a tiem ta anga Kanaan mihai ramah LALPAIN a ṭhuoi lût cheh a, ram chu a pêk pha che chun,

en: that thou shalt set apart unto Jehovah all that openeth the womb, and every firstling which thou hast that cometh of a beast; the males shall be Jehovah’s.
hmr: sul hung keu hmasa tak taphawt chu LALPA ta bîk dingin sie tum i tih. I ran nei tê hmasa tak po po a chal taphawt chu LALPA ta nîng a tih.

en: And every firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb; and if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break its neck: and all the first-born of man among thy sons shalt thou redeem.
hmr: Sabengtung tê hmasa tak chu berâmtein intlan i tih; în tlan naw ding chun a rîng chu her bawng i tih. I naupasalhai lai khawm nau lutîr po po chu intlan i tih.

en: And it shall be, when thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What is this? that thou shalt say unto him, By strength of hand Jehovah brought us out from Egypt, from the house of bondage:
hmr: Chun, nakie hun la hung tlung dinga khawm i naupain, Hi hi a umzie ieng am a na? tiha ân dawn che chun, a kuomah hieng hin hril i tih, “Suoka umna ram Aiguptaa inthawk LALPAIN kut thahrâtin a mi ṭhuoi suok tah a.

en: and it came to pass, when Pharaoh would hardly let us go, that Jehovah slew all the first-born in the land of Egypt, both the first-born of man, and the first-born of beast: therefore I sacrifice to Jehovah all that openeth the womb, being males; but all the first-born of my sons I redeem.
hmr: Pharao chun lulul suoin mîn suoktir naw ṭâl sien khawm, LALPA chun Aigupta rama nau lutîr po po: mihriem le ran tê a pieng hmasa tak po po chu a sukhlum ta vawng a. Chuleiin, sul hung kêutu hmasa tak a chal taphawt chu LALPA kuomah kân hlân a, ka naupasalhai nau lutîr taphawt ruok chu ân tlanin kân tlan a nih.

en: And it shall be for a sign upon thy hand, and for frontlets between thine eyes: for by strength of hand Jehovah brought us forth out of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, i mithai kâra thilkhim ding le i kut chunga inchikna dingin nîng a tih; LALPA chun kut thahrât chun Aigupta rama inthawkin a ṭhuoi suok ta si cheh a, tiin,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not by the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said, Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war, and they return to Egypt:
hmr: Pharaoin mipui chu ân suoktir phing chun, Pathienin, “An fenaa hin indona an va hmu pha mipui chu insîr an ta, Aiguptaa chun kîr nâwk rawi an tih,” a ti leiin a lam chu hnai sien khawm Philistin mihai ram fe thlengna lam tieng chun Pathienin anni chu a ṭhuoi nawh a.

en: but God led the people about, by the way of the wilderness by the Red Sea: and the children of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.
hmr: Tuipui sen tieng, thlalêr tienga lam inhêl zâwng chun mipui chu Pathienin a ṭhuoi ta lem a, Israel thlahai chu râlthuom kim leh Aigupta rama inthawk chun an suok tah a.

en: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had straitly sworn the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you.
hmr: Mosie chun Josef ruhai chu a chawi pei a, Israel thlahai chu, “Pathienin hung kan ngei ngei a ti cheu a, chun in fena taphawtah ka ru khawm sawm pei in tih,” tiin a lo tiem ta hrim a.

en: And they took their journey from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, in the edge of the wilderness.
hmr: Sukkotha inthawkin an fe suok a, thlalêr sîr Ethama chun bûk an khuor tah a.

en: And Jehovah went before them by day in a pillar of cloud, to lead them the way, and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; that they might go by day and by night:
hmr: Zâna le sûna khawm an fe theina dingin, LALPA chu sûnah sûm ngîrin an hma ṭhuoi dingin le zânah mei ngîrin anni var pe dingin, an hmaah a fe pei a;

en: the pillar of cloud by day, and the pillar of fire by night, departed not from before the people.
hmr: sûna sûm ngîr le zâna mei ngîr chu mipui hmaha inthawk chun ân kieng ngai hrim hrim nawh a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Mosie kuom- ah,

en: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal-zephon: over against it shall ye encamp by the sea.
hmr: “Israel thlahai kuomah hril la, ‘Kîr nâwk hai sienla, Pi-hahiroth phâk hma, Migdol le tuipui inkâr, tuipui kâwl, Baalzephon hma zawn, a ep chieha chun riebûk bawl raw hai se.

en: And Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are entangled in the land, the wilderness hath shut them in.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pharaoin Israel thlahai chu, “Rampalailakah an inhmanga thlalêrin anni a khârkhum an tah,” tîng a tih.

en: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and he shall follow after them; and I will get me honor upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host: and the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah. And they did so.
hmr: Chun, Pharao lungril chu suk- ngar ka ta, anni chu hung hnawtzui a tih; chun, Pharao le a sipaihai chungah ropuina chang ka tih: chun, Aigupta mihai chun LALPA ka ni mi hre tâng an tih,’ tiin,” a tih a. Chuong ang tak chun an thaw tah a.

en: And it was told the king of Egypt that the people were fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was changed towards the people, and they said, What is this we have done, that we have let Israel go from serving us?
hmr: Mipui chu an tlân suok tah ti Aigupta lal chu hrila a um chun, mipui chungthua Pharao le a siehlawhai lungril chu ân let ta thut a, “Hi thil ei thaw hi ieng am a nih a, Israel mihai ei rawng an bâwlnaa inthawk ei insuoktir el hi?” an tih a.

en: And he made ready his chariot, and took his people with him:
hmr: Pharao chun a sakawr tawlai- lîrhai chu a siemrêl a, a mihai chu a ṭhuoi a,

en: and he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, and captains over all of them.
hmr: Aiguptaa sakawr tawlailîr po po le, sakawr tawlailîr thlang ṭhieu za ruk, an chunga sipai hotu seng leh a ṭhuoi a.

en: And Jehovah hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued after the children of Israel: for the children of Israel went out with a high hand.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Aigupta lal Pharao lungril chu a sukngar a, Israel thlahai chu a hnawt zui tah a; Israel thlahai chu muongchara suok an ni sih a.

en: And the Egyptians pursued after them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his army, and overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.
hmr: Aigupta mihai chun an hnungah an hnawt tah a, Pharao sakawr tawlailîr le sakawr po po le, a sakawr chung chuong mihai le, a sipai ruol le chun; chuongchun, Baalzephon ep, Pi-hahiroth sîr, tuipui kâwla an riebûk bâwlnaa chun an hnawt phâk tah a.

en: And when Pharaoh drew nigh, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and, behold, the Egyptians were marching after them; and they were sore afraid: and the children of Israel cried out unto Jehovah.
hmr: Pharao chu a hung hnai chun Israel thlahai chun an hang en a, an hnunga Aigupta mihai hung ṭhuop ṭhuop chu an hang hmuh a, nasa- takin an ṭih a, Israel thlahai chun LALPA chu an ko tah a.

en: And they said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? wherefore hast thou dealt thus with us, to bring us forth out of Egypt?
hmr: Mosie kuomah, “Aiguptaah thlânhai a um naw leiin a ni maw thlalêra thi dinga i mi ṭhuoi suok hi? Aiguptaa inthawk mi ṭhuoi suok a i thilthaw dân hi iengtizie am a na?

en: Is not this the word that we spake unto thee in Egypt, saying, Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians? For it were better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.
hmr: Aiguptaa khawm Aigupta mihai rawng kan bâwl theina dingin mi tosan el rawh, ‘Thlalêra kan thi hmang nêk chun Aigupta mihai rawng hi bâwl inlang kan ta dingin a ṭha lem sih a,’ tiha i kuoma kan hril kha hi hi a ni ta ngei ni lo am a nih?” an tih a.

en: And Moses said unto the people, Fear ye not, stand still, and see the salvation of Jehovah, which he will work for you to-day: for the Egyptians whom ye have seen to-day, ye shall see them again no more for ever.
hmr: Mosie chun mipui kuoma chun, “Ngîr ṭawk ṭawk unla, ṭi naw ro, LALPA sandamna, in ta dinga vawisûn a thaw ding chu en el ro; vawisûna Aigupta mi in hmuhai hi kumkhuoin in hmu nâwk ta naw ding a ni sih a.

en: Jehovah will fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
hmr: LALPA chun in ta dingin do a ta, nangni ruok chu in um ṭawk ṭawk ding a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Wherefore criest thou unto me? speak unto the children of Israel, that they go forward.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Iengdinga i mi ko am a na? Israel thlahai kuomah hril la, hmatieng fe pei raw hai se.

en: And lift thou up thy rod, and stretch out thy hand over the sea, and divide it: and the children of Israel shall go into the midst of the sea on dry ground.
hmr: I hmawl kha chawi sâng la, i kut kha tuipui chungah phar suok la, tuipui chu ṭhe rawh, Israel thlahai chu tuipui inkâra chun hnuoi hula an fe theina dingin.

en: And I, behold, I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they shall go in after them: and I will get me honor upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
hmr: Chun, keiin Aigupta mihai lungril sukngar ka ta, an hnungah hung lût vêng an tih; chun, Pharao le a sipai ruol po po, a sakawr tawlailîr po po le, a sakawr chung chuong mihai chungah ropuina chang ka tih.

en: And the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah, when I have gotten me honor upon Pharaoh, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
hmr: Aigupta mihai chun Pharao le a sakawr tawlailîrhai le a sakawr chung chuong mihai chunga ropuina ka chang pha chun LALPA ka nih ti hre tâng an tih,” a tih a.

en: And the angel of God, who went before the camp of Israel, removed and went behind them; and the pillar of cloud removed from before them, and stood behind them:
hmr: Chun, LALPA vântirko Israel- hai bûk hmaha fe chu ân tâwl a, an hnungah a fe tah a: chun, sûm ngîr chu an hmaha inthawkin ân tâwl a, an hnungah a ngîr a:

en: and it came between the camp of Egypt and the camp of Israel; and there was the cloud and the darkness, yet gave it light by night: and the one came not near the other all the night.
hmr: Israel mihai le Aigupta mihai riebûk inkâra chun a hung a. Chuongchun, sûm le inthim chu a um a, zân chu sûm chun a sukvar hlau thung a, zânkhuoin tu tu khawm an inhnai tuo nawh a.

en: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and Jehovah caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all the night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
hmr: Chun, Mosiein tuipui chunga chun a kut a phar a, chun LALPAIN sak thli hrâttak zânkhawvâra hrâng- in tuipui chu ân luong kîrtir a, tuipui chu ram ṭâwlah a siem a, tuihai chu an inṭhe tah a.

en: And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground: and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
hmr: Israel thlahai chu tuipui inkâra chun hnuoi hulah an fe tah a; tuihai chu an changtieng le vawitieng bang angin a um a.

en: And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them into the midst of the sea, all Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
hmr: Aigupta mihai chun an hnawt pei a, Pharao sakawrhai, a sakawr tawlailîrhai le, a sakawr chung chuong mihai po po chu an hnunga chun tuipui inkâra chun an lût veh a.

en: And it came to pass in the morning watch, that Jehovah looked forth upon the host of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of cloud, and discomfited the host of the Egyptians.
hmr: Zîngtieng vêng hunah LALPA chun Aigupta sipai ruol chu mei ngîr le sûma chun a zuk en a, Aigupta sipai ruol chu a sukbuoi tah a.

en: And he took off their chariot wheels, and they drove them heavily; so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for Jehovah fighteth for them against the Egyptians.
hmr: An sakawr tawlailîr kekuolhai chu a sukthlawngpêk a, intaktakin an khal tah a; chuongchun, Aigupta mihai chun, “Israelhai hmaha in- thawkin tlân el ei tiu, LALPA chun an ta dingin Aigupta mihai chu a dopêk a ni hi,” an tih a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the sea, that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Mosie kuom- ah, “Tuipui chungah i kut kha phar rawh, Aigupta mihai le, an sakawr tawlailîrhai le, an sakawr chung chuong mihai chungah tui chu a hung luongna dingin,” a tih a.

en: And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to its strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it; and Jehovah overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
hmr: Mosie chun tuipui chunga chun a kut chu a phar a, zîngkâr a hung ni chun tuipui chu a luong hrât pângngaiin a luong nâwk tah a; Aigupta mihai chu an tlânsieh a, LALPA chun Aigupta mihai chu tuipuia chun a peilût tah a.

en: And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, even all the host of Pharaoh that went in after them into the sea; there remained not so much as one of them.
hmr: Tui chu a kîr nâwk a, sakawr tawlailîrhai, sakawr chung chuong mihai le, Pharao sipai ruol, an hnunga hung hnawttuhai ngei chu ân khum ta vawng a, pakhat khawm hlain an um ta nawh a.

en: But the children of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea; and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
hmr: Israel thlahai ruok chu tuipui kâra chun hnuoi hulah an feh a, tui chu an changtieng le vawitieng chun bang angin a umpêk a.

en: Thus Jehovah saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea-shore.
hmr: Chu ni chun LALPAIN Israel- hai chu Aigupta mihai kuta inthawk- in a sanhim tah a, vadung pang sîr vêla Aigupta mi thihai chu Israelhai chun an hmuh a.

en: And Israel saw the great work which Jehovah did upon the Egyptians, and the people feared Jehovah: and they believed in Jehovah, and in his servant Moses.
hmr: Israelhai chun Aigupta mihai chunga LALPAIN thil ropuitak a thaw chu an hmuh a, mipui chun LALPA chu an ṭi tah a; LALPA le a siehlaw Mosie chu an ring tah a.

en: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto Jehovah, and spake, saying, I will sing unto Jehovah, for he hath triumphed gloriously: The horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
hmr: Chun, Mosie le Israel thlahai chun LALPA kuomah hi hla hi an sak a, “Ropuitaka a hne ta leiin LALPA kuomah hla sak ka tih. Sakawr le a chunga chuong chu tuipuiah a pei lût a.

en: Jehovah is my strength and song, And he is become my salvation: This is my God, and I will praise him; My father’s God, and I will exalt him.
hmr: LALPA chu ka hrâtna le ka hla a nih, Ka sandamna khawm a hung ni tah; Hi hi ka Pathien a na, ama chu inpâk ka tih: Ka thlatu Pathien a na, ama chu chawimawi ka tih.

en: Jehovah is a man of war: Jehovah is his name.
hmr: LALPA chu indo mi a nih; LALPA chu a hming a nih.

en: Pharaoh’s chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea; And his chosen captains are sunk in the Red Sea.
hmr: Pharao sakawr tawlailîrhai le sipai ruol chu tuipuiah a pei lût tah a; A sipai hotu thlanghai khawm chu Tuipui Senah an tlum zo tah.

en: The deeps cover them: They went down into the depths like a stone.
hmr: Limawng inthûkahai chun lung angin an tlum thlah a; Tuipui inthûk chun anni ân khum a.

en: Thy right hand, O Jehovah, is glorious in power, Thy right hand, O Jehovah, dasheth in pieces the enemy.
hmr: Aw LALPA, i kut changtieng chu thilthawtheinain a ropui a, Aw LALPA, i kut changtieng chun hmêlma chu a nuoihâwp a.

en: And in the greatness of thine excellency thou overthrowest them that rise up against thee: Thou sendest forth thy wrath, it consumeth them as stubble.
hmr: I lalna ropuina chun nangma dotuhai che chu i peithlâk a: I lunginsenna chu i tir suok a, anni chu bupawl angin a kânghmang a.

en: And with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were piled up, The floods stood upright as a heap; The deeps were congealed in the heart of the sea.
hmr: I hnarkuohai mûtthlît chun tuihai chu ân thuo ûr a, Tui lienhai chu vûm thûrin a ngîr tah a; Tuipui sûngrila limawnghai chu sukkhalin an um tah a.

en: The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; My desire shall be satisfied upon them; I will draw my sword, my hand shall destroy them.
hmr: Hmêlma chun, ‘Hnawt ka ta, hnawtphâk ka ta, râllâk thil chu sem ka tih; Ka dittâwkin annia inthawk lâng ka ta, Ka kâwlhnâm phawi ka ta, ka kutin anni sukbohmang ka tih,’ a tih a.

en: Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them: They sank as lead in the mighty waters.
hmr: Nangin i thli chun în mûttir a, tuipui chun anni ân khum tah a: Tui hrâtahai chun suon tlang angin an tlum hmang tah a.

en: Who is like unto thee, O Jehovah, among the gods? Who is like thee, glorious in holiness, Fearful in praises, doing wonders?
hmr: Aw LALPA, pathienhai lai hin nanga ang tu am an um a? Inthiengnaa ropui, thilthaw ropuihaia ṭium, Thilmakhai thaw, Nanga ang tu am an um a?

en: Thou stretchedst out thy right hand, The earth swallowed them.
hmr: I kut changtieng chu i phar a, Anni chu hnuoiin a lem zo tah a.

en: Thou in thy lovingkindness hast led the people that thou hast redeemed: Thou hast guided them in thy strength to thy holy habitation.
hmr: Nangin i zângainain mipui în tlanhai chu i ṭhuoi a; I umna hmun inthiengah i hrâtnain anni chu i ṭhuoi a.

en: The peoples have heard, they tremble: Pangs have taken hold on the inhabitants of Philistia.
hmr: Mipuihai chun an hriet a, an inthin a; Philistin mihai chu lungngainain an sip a.

en: Then were the chiefs of Edom dismayed; The mighty men of Moab, trembling taketh hold upon them: All the inhabitants of Canaan are melted away.
hmr: Tuhin Edom lalhai chu an lunginzîng a, Moab mi hrâthai chu inthinnain a man a, Kanaan hluotuhai po po chu an intui zo tah a.

en: Terror and dread falleth upon them; By the greatness of thine arm they are as still as a stone; Till thy people pass over, O Jehovah, Till the people pass over that thou hast purchased.
hmr: Inlâuna le ṭitnain anni a vûr a, I kut thahrâtna leiin anni chu lung ang elin an to ṭawk ṭawk a; I mipuiin an fe khêl chenin, Aw LALPA: I mipui i închâwkhaiin an fe khêl chen chun.

en: Thou wilt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance, The place, O Jehovah, which thou hast made for thee to dwell in, The sanctuary, O Lord, which thy hands have established.
hmr: Nangin anni chu hung la lût i ta, i ro tlângah phun i tih; Aw LALPA, nangin i umna hmun dinga i siema chun, Aw LALPA, hmun inthieng nangin i kuta i siema chun.

en: Jehovah shall reign for ever and ever.
hmr: LALPA chun chatuonin ro rêl a tih,” tiin.

en: For the horses of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and Jehovah brought back the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel walked on dry land in the midst of the sea.
hmr: Pharao sakawrhai chu a sakawr tawlailîrhai le sakawr chung chuong mihai leh tuipuiah an lût phing chun, LALPAIN tuipui tuihai an chungah ân luongtir nâwk ta sih a; Israel thlahai ruok chu tuipui inkâra chun hnuoi hulah an feh a.

en: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
hmr: Chun zâwlneinu Miriam, Aron farnu chun khuongtê a lâk a, nuhmei po po chun khuongtêhai le lâmin an zui a.

en: And Miriam answered them, Sing ye to Jehovah, for he hath triumphed gloriously; The horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
hmr: Miriam chun, “Ropuitaka a hne ta leiin LALPA kuoma chun hla sak ro; Sakawr le a chunga chuong chu tuipuiah a pei lût a,” tiin a dawn a.

en: And Moses led Israel onward from the Red Sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no water.
hmr: Mosie chun Israelhai chu Tuipui Sena inthawk chun a ṭhuoi pei a, Sur thlalêr chu an hung tlung tah a, chun, thlalêra ni thum an fe chun tui an hmu ta nawh a.

en: And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter: therefore the name of it was called Marah.
hmr: Mara hmun an hung tlung chun, Mara hmuna tui chu a khâk leiin an dâwn thei ta nawh a; chuleiin, chu hmun chu Mara inbûk a ni tah a.

en: And the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?
hmr: Mipui chu, “Ieng am dâwn tâng ei ta?” tiin Mosie chungah an chier tah a.

en: And he cried unto Jehovah; and Jehovah showed him a tree, and he cast it into the waters, and the waters were made sweet. There he made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there he proved them;
hmr: Ama chun LALPA chu a ko a; LALPA chun thing ân entir a, chu chu tuia chun a dêng lût a, tui chu a hung inhnik tah a. Chutaka chun dân le dân ziek chu an kuomah a siem a, anni chu chutaka chun a fie bawk a:

en: and he said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of Jehovah thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his eyes, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of the diseases upon thee, which I have put upon the Egyptians: for I am Jehovah that healeth thee.
hmr: ama chun, “LALPA in Pathien rawl chu nguntaka in ngai a, a mit hmuha thildik chu in thawh a, a thupekhai tieng in na in sit a, a dân ziekhai chu in vawng tlat chun, Aigupta mihai chunga kân tlungtir natnahai hrim hrim kha in chungah intlungtir dêr naw ningah: LALPA nangni sukdamtu cheu chu ka ni sih a,” a tih a.

en: And they came to Elim, where were twelve springs of water, and threescore and ten palm-trees: and they encamped there by the waters.
hmr: Chun, Elim an hung tlung a; chu hmuna chun tuikhur sâwmpahni le tûm thing sawmsari an um a; chuongchun, tuikhurhai vêla chun bûk an khuor tah a.

en: And they took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came unto the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
hmr: Elima inthawk chun an inzin suok a, Israel thla mipui po po chu, Aigupta ram an suoksanna thla hnina ni sâwmpanga ni tak chun, Sinai le Elim inkâra Sin thlalêr chu an hung tlung a.

en: And the whole congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron in the wilderness:
hmr: Israel thla mipui po po chu thlalêra chun Mosie le Aron chunga chun an chier tah a.

en: and the children of Israel said unto them, Would that we had died by the hand of Jehovah in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh-pots, when we did eat bread to the full; for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness, to kill this whole assembly with hunger.
hmr: Israel thlahai chun an kuomah, “Aigupta rama sa bêlhai leh kan ṭhung a, bei kan dittâwka fa zing khan LALPA kuta chun thi el inlang ni ding bah: hieng mipui po po hi phîngṭâma thi ding elin thlalêrah in mi ṭhuoi lût a ni ta hi,” an tih a.

en: Then said Jehovah unto Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather a day’s portion every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or not.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Mosie kuom- ah, “Ngai rawh, vâna inthawkin in ta dingin bei ka hung insûrtir ding a nih: mipui va fe suok an ta, ka dân an zâwm le an zâwm naw anni ka fie theina dingin ni tin ni khat tlatâwk la khâwm raw hai se.

en: And it shall come to pass on the sixth day, that they shall prepare that which they bring in, and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.
hmr: Ni ruk nia chun ni tina an lâk khâwm zât lethni la khâwm an ta, chu chu buotsai an tih,” a tih a.

en: And Moses and Aaron said unto all the children of Israel, At even, then ye shall know that Jehovah hath brought you out from the land of Egypt;
hmr: Mosie le Aron chun Israel thlahai po po kuoma chun, “Zântieng pha, LALPA chu a nih Aigupta rama inthawka ṭhuoi suoktu cheu chu ti hrieng in ta,

en: and in the morning, then ye shall see the glory of Jehovah; for that he heareth your murmurings against Jehovah: and what are we, that ye murmur against us?
hmr: zîngtieng leh LALPA ropuina chu hmûng in tih; LALPA chun a chunga in chiernahai chu a hriet sih a. Keini chu ieng am kan niha in mi chier khum hi?” an tih a.

en: And Moses said, This shall be, when Jehovah shall give you in the evening flesh to eat, and in the morning bread to the full; for that Jehovah heareth your murmurings which ye murmur against him: and what are we? your murmurings are not against us, but against Jehovah.
hmr: Mosie bawk chun, “Zântieng chun sa le zîngtieng chun bei dittâwk fâk ding a pêk pha cheu chun LALPA a nih ti hrieng in tih, a chunga in chiernahai chu LALPA chun a hriet sih a: keini chu ieng am kan nih a? In chierna chu keini chungah ni loin LALPA chungah a ni lem in sawnnaw,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said unto Aaron, Say unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, Come near before Jehovah; for he hath heard your murmurings.
hmr: Chun, Mosiein Aron kuomah, “Israel thla mipui po po kuoma chun, ‘LALPA hmaa chun hung hnai ro, in chiernahai po po chu a hriet sih a,’ ti rawh,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass, as Aaron spake unto the whole congregation of the children of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, and, behold, the glory of Jehovah appeared in the cloud.
hmr: Chun, Israel thla mipui po po kuoma Aronin a hril phingleh, thlalêr tieng chu an en a, sûm laia Pathien ropuina hung inlang chu an hmuh a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah a hril a,

en: I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel: speak unto them, saying, At even ye shall eat flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread: and ye shall know that I am Jehovah your God.
hmr: “Israel thlahai chiernahai chu ka hriet a, an kuomah, ‘Zântieng chun sa fâng in ta, zîngtieng chun beia sukkhawp nîng in tih, chun LALPA in Pathien chu ka nih ti hrieng in tih’ ti rawh,” tiin.

en: And it came to pass at even, that the quails came up, and covered the camp: and in the morning the dew lay round about the camp.
hmr: Zântieng chun hieng hi a nih a, vamîmhai an hung suok a, riebûk chu a tuomin an hung tuom tah a: zîngkâr ruok chun riebûk vêla chun daidaw a kûr ṭuk el a.

en: And when the dew that lay was gone up, behold, upon the face of the wilderness a small round thing, small as the hoar-frost on the ground.
hmr: Daidaw chuonga kûr ṭuk chu a hul hnung chun, ngai ta, thil inhlûm chite te, hnuoi chunga vûr tlang te vâr sar ang hi thlalêr chung po poa chun a um tah a.

en: And when the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another, What is it? for they knew not what it was. And Moses said unto them, It is the bread which Jehovah hath given you to eat.
hmr: Israel thlahaiin chu chu an hmu chun ieng am a nih an hriet si nawh a, “Ieng am a na?” an inti tâwl a. Mosie chun an kuomah, “LALPAIN fâk dinga bei a pêk cheu chu a ni hi.

en: This is the thing which Jehovah hath commanded, Gather ye of it every man according to his eating; an omer a head, according to the number of your persons, shall ye take it, every man for them that are in his tent.
hmr: Hi hi LALPAIN, ‘Mi tin fâk tâwk ang peiin rût ro; mi lu kipin omer khat pei, mi tinin a puon ina mihai ta dingin, in mihai zât ang peiin rût in tih,’ tiha thu a pêk kha a ni hi,” a tih a.

en: And the children of Israel did so, and gathered some more, some less.
hmr: Israel thlahai chun chuong ang tak chun an thawh a, ṭhenkhatin tam deu, ṭhenkhatin tlâwm deu an rût tah a.

en: And when they measured it with an omer, he that gathered much had nothing over, and he that gathered little had no lack; they gathered every man according to his eating.
hmr: Chun, omer khat peia an inkhi chun a rût tamtu khawm chun a chuong iengkhawm a nei nawh a, a rût tlâwmtu khawm chu a tlasam chuong naw bawk a; mi tin fâk tâwk ang peiin an rût tah a.

en: And Moses said unto them, Let no man leave of it till the morning.
hmr: Chun, Mosiein an kuomah, “Zîngkâr chen tukhawmin hla naw raw se,” a tih a.

en: Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and became foul: and Moses was wroth with them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Mosie thu chu an ngai nawh a, ṭhenkhatin zîngkâr chenin an hlah a, a lo inngeh a, a thu tah a; Mosie chu an chungah a lunginsen ta hleh a.

en: And they gathered it morning by morning, every man according to his eating: and when the sun waxed hot, it melted.
hmr: Tûk tin elin an rût a, mi tin chun a fâk tâwk ang peiin. Sûna nisa a hung lum pha ruok chun ân tui hmang hlak a.

en: And it came to pass, that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for each one: and all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.
hmr: Ni ruk ni ruok chun fâk tâwk lêt hni, mi tin ta dinga omer hni peiin an rût a; chun, mipui hotuhai chu an hung a, Mosie kuomah an hril a.

en: And he said unto them, This is that which Jehovah hath spoken, To-morrow is a solemn rest, a holy sabbath unto Jehovah: bake that which ye will bake, and boil that which ye will boil; and all that remaineth over lay up for you to be kept until the morning.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Hi hi a nih LALPAIN a hril kha: Zînga chu LALPA ta dinga Châwl ni inthieng, châwl ṭawk ṭawk ding ni chu a nih; in suong ding chu suong unla, in zêu ding chu zêu unla, chun, a mahla po po chu zîngkâr chen in ta dinga sie dingin hla el ro,” a tih a.

en: And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade: and it did not become foul, neither was there any worm therein.
hmr: Mosiein a ti ang chun zîngkâr chena dingin an sie tah a; chuong- chun, a lo thu nawh a, a nge hrim khawm a um bawk nawh.

en: And Moses said, Eat that to-day; for to-day is a sabbath unto Jehovah: to-day ye shall not find it in the field.
hmr: Mosie chun, “Kha kha vawisûn fa ro, vawisûn hi chu LALPA kuoma Châwl ni inthieng a ni sih a: vawisûn chu in rûtna hlak hmuna hrim hrim hmu naw ti niu.

en: Six days ye shall gather it; but on the seventh day is the sabbath, in it there shall be none.
hmr: Ni ruk sûng chu la khâwm in ta, ni sari ni ruok chu Châwl ni a nih a, chu ni chun pakhat khawm um naw nih,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that there went out some of the people to gather, and they found none.
hmr: Ni sari ni chun mipui laia ṭhenkhat chu va rût dingin an fe suoka chu pakhat khawm an hmu nawh.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, How long refuse ye to keep my commandments and my laws?
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Mosie kuom- ah, “Ka thupêkhai le ka dânhai chu zâwm nuom loin ieng chen am in um ding a na?

en: See, for that Jehovah hath given you the sabbath, therefore he giveth you on the sixth day the bread of two days; abide ye every man in his place, let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.
hmr: Ngai ta u, LALPA chun Châwl ni a pêk cheu leiin ni ruk ni chun ni hni tla bei a pêk si cheu a, mi tin chu in hmun sengah um ṭawk ṭawk ro, ni sari ni chun a hmuna inthawk tukhawm fe suok naw raw se,” a tih a.

en: So the people rested on the seventh day.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui chu ni sari ni chun an châwl tah a.

en: And the house of Israel called the name thereof Manna: and it was like coriander seed, white; and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.
hmr: Chun, Israel sûnghai chun, chu hminga chun Manna an inbûk a; koriendar chi anga vâr, ân hnikzie chu bei inphân khuoizu le siem ang hi a nih.

en: And Moses said, This is the thing which Jehovah hath commanded, Let an omerful of it be kept throughout your generations, that they may see the bread wherewith I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you forth from the land of Egypt.
hmr: Mosie chun, hi thil hi a nih LALPAIN, “In thlahai ta dingin omer sip khat kawl zing ro, Aigupta rama inthawka ka ṭhuoi suok lai cheua ka châwmna cheu bei chu an hmu theina dingin, tiha thu a lo pêk chu,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take a pot, and put an omerful of manna therein, and lay it up before Jehovah, to be kept throughout your generations.
hmr: Mosie chun Aron kuomah, “Bêl la la, omer sip khat manna chutaka chun sie rawh, chun, i thlahai ta dinga kawl dingin LALPA hmaa chun sie ṭha rawh,” a tih a.

en: As Jehovah commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.
hmr: LALPAIN Mosie thu a pêk ang tak chun Aron chun kawl zing dingin, thuthlungna bâwm hmaa chun a sie tah a.

en: And the children of Israel did eat the manna forty years, until they came to a land inhabited; they did eat the manna, until they came unto the borders of the land of Canaan.
hmr: Israel thlahai chun mi umna ram an hung tlung hma po kum sawmli sûng chu manna chu an fâk tah a. Kanaan ram ramrihai an hung tlung chen chun an fâk a.

en: Now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.
hmr: (Omer khat chu Epha hmun sâwma ṭheha hmun khat a nih.)

en: And all the congregation of the children of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, by their journeys, according to the commandment of Jehovah, and encamped in Rephidim: and there was no water for the people to drink.
hmr: Israel thla mipui po po chu LALPA thupêk angin, an inzin dânbi ang peiin, Sin thlalêra inthawk chu an suok tah a, Rephidimah puon in an zar a; nisienlakhawm, chu hmuna chun mipui ta dingin tui dâwn ding a um nawh a.

en: Wherefore the people strove with Moses, and said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said unto them, Why strive ye with me? wherefore do ye tempt Jehovah?
hmr: Chuleiin, mipui chun Mosie an insêlpui a, “Tui dâwn ding mi pe rawh,” an tih a. Mosie chun an kuomah, “Iengdinga kei in min sêlpui am a na? Iengdinga LALPA chu in fie am a na?” a tih a.

en: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore hast thou brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?
hmr: Mipui hlak chu tui duin an dang a châr hleh a, Mosie chunga chun an chier a, “Aiguptaa inthawk keini le kan nauhai le kan ran ruol leh dang- châra mi sukhlum dingin iengdinga i mi ṭhuoi suok am a na?” an tih a.

en: And Moses cried unto Jehovah, saying, What shall I do unto this people? they are almost ready to stone me.
hmr: Mosie chun LALPA a ko a, “Hi mipui hi iengtin am thâwng ka ta? Lunga mi dêng dingin an intûng el a ni sih a,” tiin.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Pass on before the people, and take with thee of the elders of Israel; and thy rod, wherewith thou smotest the river, take in thy hand, and go.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Mipui hmaa chun fe la, Israel upahai i kuomah ṭhuoi la, chun, vadung i vuokna hmawl kha i kutin chawi bawk la, fe rawh.

en: Behold, I will stand before thee there upon the rock in Horeb; and thou shalt smite the rock, and there shall come water out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
hmr: Ngai ta, Horeba lungpui chunga sawn i hmaah ngîr ka ta; chun, lung- pui chu vuong i ta, a sûnga inthawkin tui hung suok a tih, mipuiin an dâwn theina dingin,” a tih a. Mosie chun Israel upahai mithmu ngeiah chuong ang tak chun a thaw tah a.

en: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the striving of the children of Israel, and because they tempted Jehovah, saying, Is Jehovah among us, or not?
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai helna leiin le “LALPA hi eini lai a um am a ni, a um naw?” tiha, LALPA an infiena lei chun, chu hmun hminga chun Massa le Meriba ân bûk tah a.

en: Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
hmr: Chun, Amalekhai chu an hung a, Rephidimah Israelhai chu an hung do tah a.

en: And Moses said unto Joshua, Choose us out men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to-morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.
hmr: Mosie chun Joshua kuomah, “Eini lai pasalhai thlang suok la, fe unla, Amalekhai chu va do ro; zîng- ah Pathien hmawl chu ka kuta chawiin tlâng sîpah ngîr ka tih,” a tih a.

en: So Joshua did as Moses had said to him, and fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
hmr: Joshua chun a kuoma Mosiein a hril ang tak chun a thawh a, Amalekhai chu an do tah a; Mosie, Aron le Hur chu tlâng sîpa chun an hang fe tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed; and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
hmr: Mosiein a hmawl ân let sûng po chu Israelhai chun an hneh a, chun, a kut a lâkthlâk phingleh Amalekhai chun an hne ve thung pei a.

en: But Moses’ hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat thereon; and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
hmr: Mosie kuthai chu a hung kham chun, lung an lâk a, a hnuoia chun an sieh a, chu chunga chun a ṭhung tah a. Aron le Hur chun sîr khatah pakhat, sîr dangah pakhatin a kuthai chu an dawm tung zing a; chuong- chun, nisa tlâk hmakhat chu a kuthai chu a phar thei ta zing a.

en: And Joshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
hmr: Chun, Joshua chun Amalek le a mihai chu kâwlhnâm ngeiin a sunthlûk dêr tâwl tah a.

en: and Jehovah said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: that I will utterly blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Lekhabuah hi hi hriet zing- na dingin ziek la, vân hnuoi po poa inthawkin Amalek hriet zingna hi thaihmang dêr ka tih ti Joshua naa chun inhriettir rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovah-nissi;
hmr: Chun, Mosie chun mâichâm a siem a, a hminga chun “Jehova- Nissi” ân bûk a;

en: and he said, Jehovah hath sworn: Jehovah will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
hmr: “LALPA chu ka puonzâr a nih” tiin. “LALPA chu ân khâm tah a, LALPA chun a thlahai thla nâwk- sâwng chen khawmin Amalek chunga hin dona nei hlak a tih,” tiin

en: Now Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, how that Jehovah had brought Israel out of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Jethro, Midian mihai thiempu, Mosie tarpupa chun Mosie le a mi Israelhai ta dinga Pathienin thil a thawpêkzie, Ai- guptaa inthawkin Israelhai chu LALPAIN a hung ṭhuoi suokzie chu a lo hriet a.

en: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her away,
hmr: Chun, Jethro, Mosie tarpupa chun, Mosie nuhmei, Zippora, a itirhmang ta hnung le,

en: and her two sons; of whom the name of the one was Gershom; for he said, I have been a sojourner in a foreign land:
hmr: a naupasalhai pahni chu a ṭhuoi a; chuhai pakhat hming chu Gersom a nih, “Hrietlo rama inzin ka ni tah a” a ti sih a:

en: and the name of the other was Eliezer; for he said, The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, a dang hming chu Eliezer a nih, “Ka thlatu Pathien chu ka ṭhangpuitu a na, Pharao kâwlhnâma inthawkin a mi sansuok tah a” a ti bawk a.

en: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness where he was encamped, at the mount of God:
hmr: Chun, Jethro, Mosie tarpupa chu, a naupasalhai le, a nuhmei leh Mosie kuomah, thlalêra a riebûk, Pathien tlânga chun a hung a.

en: and he said unto Moses, I, thy father-in-law Jethro, am come unto thee, and thy wife, and her two sons with her.
hmr: Ama chun Mosie kuomah, “Kei i tarpupa Jethro hi, i nuhmei le a naupasalhai pahni le chun i kuomah ka hung a nih,” tiin thu ân chah a.

en: And Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and did obeisance, and kissed him: and they asked each other of their welfare; and they came into the tent.
hmr: Mosie chu a tarpupa tuok ding chun a fe suok a, inza taka chibai bûkin ama a fâwp tah a; chun, an chanchin an indawntuo an indawn- tuoh a, puon ina chun an lût tah a.

en: And Moses told his father-in-law all that Jehovah had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the travail that had come upon them by the way, and how Jehovah delivered them.
hmr: Mosie chun, Israelhai leia Pharao chunga le Aigupta mihai chunga LALPA thil thaw ta po pohai, lampuia an chunga rimsikna hung tlunghai le, LALPAIN anni a san- suokzie chu, a tarpupa Jethro chu a hril tah a.

en: And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which Jehovah had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.
hmr: Aigupta mihai kuta inthawka sansuokin, Israelhai chunga LALPAIN thilṭha a thaw po pohai chunga chun Jethro chu a lâwm hleh a.

en: And Jethro said, Blessed be Jehovah, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh; who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
hmr: Jethro chun, “Aigupta mihai kuta inthawk le, Pharao kuta inthawka sansuoktu cheu LALPA chu inpâkin um raw se; Aigupta mihai kuta inthawka a mihai sansuoktu chu.

en: Now I know that Jehovah is greater than all gods; yea, in the thing wherein they dealt proudly against them.
hmr: Tuhin pathienhai po po nêkin LALPA chu a ropui lem ti ka hriet, chapotaka anni an sawisak lai ngeia Aigupta mihai kut hnuoia inthawk- a a mihai chu a sansuok leiin,” a tih a.

en: And Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took a burnt-offering and sacrifices for God: and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
hmr: Chun, Mosie tarpupa Jethro chun inthâwinahai le pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai Pathien ta dingin a lâk a; chun Aron chu Israel upahai po po leh Pathien hmaha Mosie tarpupa le bei fa dingin an hung tah a.

en: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses sat to judge the people: and the people stood about Moses from the morning unto the evening.
hmr: A zînga chun Mosie chu mipui ro rêlpêk dingin a ṭhung a; mipui chu zîngkâra inthawk zântieng chenin Mosie vêla chun an ngîr tah a.

en: And when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand about thee from morning unto even?
