hmr: Mosie tarpupa chun mipui kuoma a thilthaw po po chu a hmu chun, “Mipui ta dinga i thaw hi ieng thil am a na? Iem a tiha nang i khât bakin în ṭhung a, mipui chu i vêlah zîngkâra inthawk zântieng chena an ngîr hi?” a tih a.

en: And Moses said unto his father-in-law, Because the people come unto me to inquire of God:
hmr: Mosie chun a tarpupa kuomah, “Mipui chu Pathien ti zâwng indawn dinga ka kuoma an hung leiin a nih.

en: when they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between a man and his neighbor, and I make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.
hmr: Thubuoi an nei pha ka kuomah an hung a; chun, a vênghai le mi dang kâra thu chu ka rêl a, Pathien dân ziekhai le a dânhai chu ka lo inhriettir hlak a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Moses’ father-in-law said unto him, The thing that thou doest is not good.
hmr: Mosie tarpupa chun a kuomah, “Hi thil i thaw hi a ṭha naw ie.

en: Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that is with thee: for the thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.
hmr: Nang le i kuoma mipui umhai hi lân sukchâu ngei ngei in tih; i ta dingin hi thil hi a rik talaw sih a; nanga khât bak chun i thaw thei nawh annawm.

en: Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God be with thee: be thou for the people to God-ward, and bring thou the causes unto God:
hmr: Tuhin, ka thu hi lo ngâi ta, thurawn hang pêng ka ti che: Pathien chu i kuomah um sienla, Pathien hmaah nang chu mipui aiawtu ni la; nangin Pathien hmaah thubuoi chu intlun pei bawk la:

en: and thou shalt teach them the statutes and the laws, and shalt show them the way wherein they must walk, and the work that they must do.
hmr: chun, dân ziekhai le dânhai chu anni inchûktir i ta, an sin thaw dinghai le, kawng an hraw ding chu anni kâwkhmu bawk i ta.

en: Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating unjust gain; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:
hmr: Chunawa khawm mipui laia inthawk mi thei thei, Pathien ṭi mi, mi indikhai, hlêpna felnaw theida mihai thlang suok la, anni chu sâng khat chunga rorêltu, za khat chunga rorêltu, sâwmnga chunga rorêltu, sâwm chunga rorêltuhai ni dingin sie rawh.

en: and let them judge the people at all seasons: and it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge themselves: so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.
hmr: Ieng lai khawmin anni chu mipui ro chu inrêltir la, thubuoi lien takhai bak hung intlun an ta, thubuoi chînhai chu annîn lo rêl el an ta; chuongchun, i ta dingin awl lem a ta, i rikphur chu an phurpui ding che annawm.

en: If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people also shall go to their place in peace.
hmr: Pathienin hieng angtaka thu a pêk cheha, hi thil hi i thaw chun, nang khawmin pei sâwt i ta, mipui po po khawm hi an hmun sengah thlamuongtakin fêng an tih,” a tih a.

en: So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said.
hmr: Mosie chun a tarpupa thu chu a ngai a, a hril po po chu a thaw tah a.

en: And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
hmr: Mosie chun Israel mihai laia inthawkin mi thei deu deu a thlang suok a, anni chu mipui luhai ni dingin, sânghai, zahai, sâwmngahai le sâwmhai chunga rorêltuhaiah a sie tah a.

en: And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
hmr: Anni chun ieng huna khawm mipui ro chu an rêlpêk a, thubuoi intakhai chu Mosie kuomah an hung intlun a, thubuoi chînhai ruok chu annîn an lo rêl tah a.

en: And Moses let his father-in-law depart; and he went his way into his own land.
hmr: Chun, Mosie chun a tarpupa chu ân fetir a; a umna ram tieng chun a fe tah a.

en: In the third month after the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they into the wilderness of Sinai.
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka Israel thlahai an fe suok chena inthawka thla thumna, chu ni chun Sinai thlalêr chu an hung tlung tah a.

en: And when they were departed from Rephidim, and were come to the wilderness of Sinai, they encamped in the wilderness; and there Israel encamped before the mount.
hmr: Rephidim an mâksan a, Sinai thlalêr an hung tlung chun thlalêra chun puon in an zar a; chutaka chun Israelhai chun tlâng hmaa chun bûk an khuor a.

en: And Moses went up unto God, and Jehovah called unto him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel:
hmr: Mosie chu Pathien kuomah a hang feh a, chun, tlânga inthawkin LALPA chun ama a hung ko a, “Jakob sûnghai lai chun hieng hin hril la, Israel thlahai chu hril rawh;

en: Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and how I bare you on eagles’ wings, and brought you unto myself.
hmr: Aigupta mihai chunga ka thil- thaw tah le, mupui thlahai chunga phur cheua ka kuoma ngei ka ṭhuoizie cheu kha in hmu tah a.

en: Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be mine own possession from among all peoples: for all the earth is mine:
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin, ka thu in awi tak tak a, ka thuthlung in kawl tak tak ding chun, hnuoi hi ka ta a ni sih a, hnam dang po po lai chun ka ta dingin ro bîk nîng in tih.

en: and ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests, and a holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.
hmr: Chun, ka ta dingin thiempuhai ram le hnam inthieng ni bawk in tih. Hieng thuhai hi a nih Israel thlahai kuoma i hril ding chu,” a tih a.

en: And Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and set before them all these words which Jehovah commanded him.
hmr: Chun, Mosie chu a hung a, Israel upahai chu ân kotir a, hieng thuhai po po LALPAIN a kuoma thu a pêkhai chu an hmaah a târlang tah a.

en: And all the people answered together, and said, All that Jehovah hath spoken we will do. And Moses reported the words of the people unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, mipui po po chun a ruolin an dawn a, “LALPAIN a hril po pohai chu thâwng kan tih,” an tih a. Mosie chun mipui thuhai chu LALPA kuoma chun ân tlun tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and may also believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people unto Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Ngai ta, i kuoma thu ka hril lai an hriet theina ding le, kumkhuoha an ring zing theina ding chein, sûm sâmup lai i kuomah hung ka tih,” a tih a. Mosie chun mipui thuhai chu LALPA chu a hril a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Go unto the people, and sanctify them to-day and to-morrow, and let them wash their garments,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Mipui kuoma chun fe la, vawisûn le zîngah sukthieng rawh, an silfênhai chu sâwp hai sienla;

en: and be ready against the third day; for the third day Jehovah will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.
hmr: ni thum ni chun inzo hieuin um raw hai se, chu ni thum ni chun Sinai tlâng chungah mipui po po mithmuah LALPA chu a hung ṭum ding a ni sih a.

en: And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, that ye go not up into the mount, or touch the border of it: whosoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death:
hmr: Chun, a vêlin ramrihai khang- pêk i ta, Tlâng hang kai lo dingin le a sîr vêl tâwk lo dingin invêng ṭha ro; tukhawm tlâng tâwk taphawt chu sukhlum nîng a tih;

en: no hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned, or shot through; whether it be beast or man, he shall not live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.
hmr: ama chu kut hrimin tâwk naw nih a, dêng hlum, annawleh, kâp hlum nîng a tih; sa khawm ni sien, mihriem khawm ni sien hring naw hrim hrim a tih: tawtawrâwt sâwttak ân ri pha, tlânga chun hung lâwn an tih,” a tih a.

en: And Moses went down from the mount unto the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their garments.
hmr: Mosie chu tlânga inthawk chun mipui kuomah a fe thlah a, mipui chu a sukthieng a, an silfênhai chu an sâwp tah a.

en: And he said unto the people, Be ready against the third day: come not near a woman.
hmr: Chun, mipui kuoma chun, “Ni thum nia chun inzosa hieuin um unla, nuhmei khawm pâwl dêr naw ro,” a tih a.

en: And it came to pass on the third day, when it was morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of a trumpet exceeding loud; and all the people that were in the camp trembled.
hmr: Ni thum ni chun zîngkâr a la ni laiin, vâninrûmhai, ṭêktlahai, tlâng chunga sûm sâmup le, tawtawrâwt ri inringtak el chu a um tah a; bûka mipui um po po chu an inthin tah a.

en: And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.
hmr: Mosie chun mipui chu Pathien tuok dingin bûka inthawk chun a hung ṭhuoi suok a, tlâng ṭhuta chun an ngîr tah a.

en: And mount Sinai, the whole of it, smoked, because Jehovah descended upon it in fire; and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.
hmr: LALPA chu meichawka a hung ṭum leiin, Sinai tlâng po po chu a khu ta vawng el a; chu khu chu rawtuina meikhu angin ân tung ta lui el a: tlâng chu nasatakin ân hnîng bawk a.

en: And when the voice of the trumpet waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by a voice.
hmr: Tawtawrâwt ri chu a hung inring deu deu chun Mosie chun a hang biek a, Pathien râwlriin a hung dawn tah a.

en: And Jehovah came down upon mount Sinai, to the top of the mount: and Jehovah called Moses to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.
hmr: LALPA chu Sinai tlâng chung- ah, tlâng sîpa chun a hung ṭum a: chun, Mosie chu tlânga chun a zuk ko a, Mosie chu a hang fe tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Go down, charge the people, lest they break through unto Jehovah to gaze, and many of them perish.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Fe thla la, mipui chu khap rawh, chuong naw chun hung en dingin LALPA kuom hung nêr thleng hlau an ta, mi tamtak bohmang rawi an tih.

en: And let the priests also, that come near to Jehovah, sanctify themselves, lest Jehovah break forth upon them.
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai LALPA hnaia hunghai khawm chu insukthieng raw hai se; chuong naw chun an chungah LALPA lungninaw rawi a tih,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said unto Jehovah, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai: for thou didst charge us, saying, Set bounds about the mount, and sanctify it.
hmr: Mosie chun LALPA kuomah, “Mipui chu Sinai tlâng hung kai thei naw ni hai, nangin, ‘Tlâng vêla chun ramrihai khang unla, sukthieng ro’, tiha i mi phût tlat leiin,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah said unto him, Go, get thee down; and thou shalt come up, thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the priests and the people break through to come up unto Jehovah, lest he break forth upon them.
hmr: LALPA chun a kuomah, “Fe rawh, nang zu fe thla la, Aron ṭhuoiin hung i ta, nisienlakhawm, thiempu- hai le mipui chu LALPA kuoma hung dingin hung innêr thlengtir naw rawh, chuong naw chun an chungah LALPA lungninaw rawi a tih,” a tih a.

en: So Moses went down unto the people, and told them.
hmr: Chuongchun, Mosie chu mipui kuoma chun a fe thlah a, anni a hril tah a.

en: And there went a man of the house of Levi, and took to wife a daughter of Levi.
hmr: Chun Levi sûnghai laia mi pakhat chu a feh a, Levi naunu nuhmeiin a nei tah a.

en: And the woman conceived, and bare a son: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.
hmr: Nuhmei chu ân rai a, naupasal a hung nei a; naupang hmêl ṭhatak a nih ti a hmuin thla thum a thup- hmang a.

en: And when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch; and she put the child therein, and laid it in the flags by the river’s brink.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a thuphmang zing thei naw phingleh phairuong lawng a lâk a, fâr hnai le lawng hnaiin a zût a; chu sûnga chun nau- pang chu a sieh a, vadung sîra phairuonghai lai chun a sie tah a.

en: And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him.
hmr: Ama chu iengtin am a um pei ti hre dingin a farnu chu hla fea hin a ngir a.

en: And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river-side; and she saw the ark among the flags, and sent her handmaid to fetch it.
hmr: Chun Pharao naunu chu va- dunga insil dingin a hung thlah a; a nunghâkhai chu vadung pang hrûla chun an fe vêl a; phairuong- hai laia lawng chu a hmu tah a, nunghâk pakhat chu va la dingin a tir a.

en: And she opened it, and saw the child: and, behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him, and said, This is one of the Hebrews’ children.
hmr: A hang hawng chun nautê chu a hmuh a: chun, ngai ta, nautê chu a ṭap tah a. Ama chu a lunginsiet a, “Hi hi Hebrai nauhai laia pakhat chu a ni ngei el,” a tih a.

en: Then said his sister to Pharaoh’s daughter, Shall I go and call thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?
hmr: Chun a farnu chun Pharao naunu kuomah, “Fêng ka ta, Hebrai nuhmei naudawntu, hi nautê dawnpêktu ding che hi ka va kopêk ding che am a nih?” a tih a.

en: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, Go. And the maiden went and called the child’s mother.
hmr: Pharao naunu chun a kuomah, “Va fe rawh,” a tih a. Chun nunghâk chu a feh a, naupang nu ngei chu a va ko tah a.

en: And Pharaoh’s daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child, and nursed it.
hmr: Chun, Pharao naunu chun a kuomah, “Hi naupang hi la la; ka ta dingin dawn rawh; chun, i hlaw tâwk pêng ka ti che,” a tih a.

en: And the child grew, and she brought him unto Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses, and said, Because I drew him out of the water.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun naupang chu a lâk a, a dawn tah a. Naupang chu a hung inṭhang lien a, Pharao naunu kuomah a hung ṭhuoi a, a naupa a hung ni tah a. Chun, “Tuia inthawka ka lâk suok a nih a” tiin a hmingah Mosie a sak a.

en: And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown up, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he saw an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew, one of his brethren.
hmr: Mosie chu a hung puitling a, ni khat chu a unauhai kuomah a fe tah a; an rikphurhai chu a hmuh a: chun, a unauhai laia mi pakhat, Hebrai mi, Aigupta miin a vuok a hmuh a.

en: And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he smote the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
hmr: Chun, a ngha vêl a ngha vêl a, mi tukhawm an um nawh ti a hmu phingin Aigupta mi chu a vuok hlum a, phaiphinah a thuphmang tah a.

en: And he went out the second day, and, behold, two men of the Hebrews were striving together: and he said to him that did the wrong, Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?
hmr: A ni hninaa a va fe suok nâwk chun, ngai ta, Hebrai mi pahni an lo insuol a; ama chun a thil suksuoltu lem kuoma chun, “Iengdinga i unau i vuok am a na?” a tih a.

en: And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? thinkest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian? And Moses feared, and said, Surely the thing is known.
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “Kan chungah lal le rorêltuin tuin am a siem cheh a? Aigupta mi i that ang khan kei khawm hi mi that i tum a ni maw?” a tih a. Chun, Mosie chu a ṭi tah a, “Hi thil hi hriet suokin a um chie tah a ni hi,” a tih a.

en: Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian: and he sat down by a well.
hmr: Pharao chun chu thil chu a hriet phingleh, Mosie chu sukhlum dingin a zawng tah a. Nisienlakhawm, Mosie chu Pharao hmaa inthawk a tlân hmang a, Midian ramah a um ta zing a; chun, tuisunsuo sîrah a ṭhung tah a.

en: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters: and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.
hmr: Midian mihai thiempu chun naunuhmei pasari a nei a; anni chu an hung a, tui an chawi a, an pa berâm ruol chu tui pe dingin tuibêlhai chu an thâl sip a.

en: And the shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
hmr: Chun, berâmpuhai chu an hung a, anni chu an hnawt hmang tah a; nisienlakhawm, Mosie chu a ngîr a, anni a ṭhangpui a, an berâm ruol chu tui ân dâwntir tah a.

en: And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How is it that ye are come so soon to-day?
hmr: An pa Reuel kuomah an hung chun, “Iengtizie am a na vawisûn chu in va hung inhma de?” a lo tih a.

en: And they said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and moreover he drew water for us, and watered the flock.
hmr: Anni chun, “Aigupta mi pakhat- in berâmpuhai kuta inthawk a mi sansuok tâwl a nih, chu bak khawm chu ni loin tui a mi chawipêk a, kan berâm ruol tui ân dâwntir bawk a,” an tih a.

en: And he said unto his daughters, And where is he? why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.
hmr: Ama chun a naunuhai kuomah, “Anleh ama chu khâwlai am a um a? chu mipa chu iengdinga in hung mâksan am? Bei fa dingin ama chu hung ko ro,” a tih a.

en: And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.
hmr: Chun, Mosie chu chu mipa kuoma um ding chun ân sukthlûk tah a; ama chun a naunu Zippora chu Mosie a pêk a.

en: And she bare a son, and he called his name Gershom; for he said, I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.
hmr: Zippora chun naupasal a nei a. Mosie chun, “Hrietlo rama inzin ka ni tah a,” a tih a, a hmingah Gersom a sak tah a.

en: And it came to pass in the course of those many days, that the king of Egypt died: and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God by reason of the bondage.
hmr: Chuong ni tamtak sûng chun Aigupta lal chu a thi tah a. Israel thlahai chu an intângna lei chun an thuok a dawng hleh a, Pathien an ko a, an intângna leia ama an kona chun Pathien kuom a tlung tah a.

en: And God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
hmr: Pathienin an inrûm chu a hriet a, Abraham, Isak le Jakob kuoma a thuthlung chu Pathienin a hriet zing a.

en: And God saw the children of Israel, and God took knowledge of them.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chu Pathien chun a hmuh a, anni chu a hriet zing bawk a.

en: And God spake all these words, saying,
hmr: Pathienin hieng thuhai po po hi a hril a,

en: I am Jehovah thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
hmr: “LALPA in Pathien, Aigupta ram, suok nina ina inthawka ṭhuoi suoktu cheu ka nih.

en: Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
hmr: Kei naw chu pathien danghai hrim i nei ding a ni nawh.

en: Thou shalt not make unto thee a graven image, nor any likeness of any thing that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:
hmr: Milim siem fâwm, chungtieng vâna mi amanih, hnuoitieng leihnuoia mi amanih, hnuoi hnuoitienga tuia mi amanih, a ieng angpui khawm i ta dingin i siem ding a ni nawh.

en: thou shalt not bow down thyself unto them, nor serve them; for I Jehovah thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generation of them that hate me,
hmr: an kuoma chun kûnin an rawng i bâwl ding a ni nawh: LALPA i Pathien hi Pathien thikthusetak, pahai khawhlona chu nauhai chunga hung intlungtir hlaktu, a mi theida- tuhai chu an thla sâwng thum le sâwng li chen chunga khawm, hung intlungtir hlaktu le

en: and showing lovingkindness unto thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.
hmr: a mi hmangaituhai le ka thupêk hai zâwmtuhai sâng tamtak chunga zângaina inentirtu chu ka ni sih a.

en: Thou shalt not take the name of Jehovah thy God in vain; for Jehovah will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.
hmr: LALPA i Pathien hming a thlâwnin i sâm mei mei ding a ni nawh; ama hming a thlâwna sâm mei meitu chu LALPA chun suol loah a ngai naw ding a ni sih a.

en: Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.
hmr: Châwlni chu vawng inthieng dingin hre zing rawh.

en: Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work;
hmr: Ni ruk sûng sin thâwng i ta, i sin po po chu thâwng i tih.

en: but the seventh day is a sabbath unto Jehovah thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy man-servant, nor thy maid-servant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates:
hmr: Ni sari ni ruok chu LALPA i Pathien kuoma châwlni a nih; chu ni chun ieng sin khawm i thaw ding a ni nawh a, nang khawmin, i naupa khawmin, i naunu khawmin, i siehlaw- pa khawmin, i siehlawnu khawmin, i ran ruol khawmin, i kawtkhâr sûnga khuolzintu khawmin a thaw ding a ni bawk nawh:

en: for in six days Jehovah made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: wherefore Jehovah blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.
hmr: ni ruk sûngin LALPA chun vân le hnuoi, tuipui le an sûnga um po po le chun a siem zo vawng a, a ni sari ni chun a châwl sih a; chuongchun, LALPAIN châwlni chu mal a sâwm a, ân ser tah a.

en: Honor thy father and thy mother, that thy days may be long in the land which Jehovah thy God giveth thee.
hmr: I nu le pa chawimawi rawh: LALPA i Pathienin a pêk che ram- a hin i nihai chu a sâwt theina ding- in.

en: Thou shalt not kill.
hmr: Tuol i that ding a ni nawh.

en: Thou shalt not commit adultery.
hmr: I uire ding a ni nawh.

en: Thou shalt not steal.
hmr: În rûk ding a ni nawh.

en: Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbor.
hmr: I vênghai chungah hrietpuina inkhêl i hril ding a ni nawh.

en: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s wife, nor his man-servant, nor his maid-servant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor anything that is thy neighbor’s.
hmr: I vênghai in în hnar ding a ni nawh; i vênghai nuhmei amanih, a siehlawpa amanih, a siehlawnu amanih, a bâwngchal amanih, a sabengtung amanih, i vênghai thil nei hrim hrim chu în hnar ding a ni nawh,” tiin.

en: And all the people perceived the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the voice of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking: and when the people saw it, they trembled, and stood afar off.
hmr: Mipui po po chun vâninrûmhai, ṭêktlahai, tawtawrâwt ri le, tlâng khu suok chu an hmu chun mipui chu an inthin a, hlatakah an ngîr a.

en: And they said unto Moses, Speak thou with us, and we will hear; but let not God speak with us, lest we die.
hmr: Anni chun Mosie kuomah, “Nangin kan kuomah thu hril la, ngai kan tih; Pathien ruok chun kan kuomah thu hril naw raw se. Chuong naw chun thîng kan tih,” an tih a.

en: And Moses said unto the people, Fear not: for God is come to prove you, and that his fear may be before you, that ye sin not.
hmr: Mosie chun mipui kuomah, “Ṭi naw ro. Pathien ṭiumna chu in hmuha in suol nawna dingin nangni infiena ding cheuin ama chu a hung a ni sih a,” a tih a.

en: And the people stood afar off, and Moses drew near unto the thick darkness where God was.
hmr: Mipui chu hlatakah an ngîr a, Mosie chun Pathien umna inthim samup tieng chu a va hnai tah a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Thus thou shalt say unto the children of Israel, Ye yourselves have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Hieng ang hin Israel thlahai kuom- ah hril rawh: Nangni ngeiin vâna inthawka ka hung biek ta cheu ti in hmuh a.

en: Ye shall not make other gods with me; gods of silver, or gods of gold, ye shall not make unto you.
hmr: Keima le biek ding pathien danghai in insiem ding a ni nawh a, in ta dingin tangkaraw pathienhai, rângkachak pathienhai in siem ding a ni bawk nawh.

en: An altar of earth thou shalt make unto me, and shalt sacrifice thereon thy burnt-offerings, and thy peace-offerings, thy sheep, and thine oxen: in every place where I record my name I will come unto thee and I will bless thee.
hmr: Ka kuomah leihnuoiin mâichâm siem i ta, chu chunga chun rawhmang thilinhlânhai, inremna thilinhlânhai le, i berâmhai le i bâwngchalhai chu hung inhlân i ta; ka hming hriet zing dinga ka tina chun i kuomah hung ka ta, mal sâwm ka ti che.

en: And if thou make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build it of hewn stones; for if thou lift up thy tool upon it, thou hast polluted it.
hmr: Lung mâichâm i mi siempêk chun, lung cherhaiin i bâwl ding a ni nawh; a chungah hriemhrei în let chun i sukpawrche a nih.

en: Neither shalt thou go up by steps unto mine altar, that thy nakedness be not uncovered thereon.
hmr: I saruokna chu hmu a ni nawna dingin, kailâwnhaiin ka mâichâma chun i hang kai ding a ni bawk nawh.

en: Now these are the ordinances which thou shalt set before them.
hmr: “Hienghai hi an kuoma i pêk ding dânhai chu an nih:

en: If thou buy a Hebrew servant, six years he shall serve: and in the seventh he shall go out free for nothing.
hmr: Hebrai siehlaw în châwk chun, kum ruk sûng i rawngbâwl a ta; a kum sarinaa chun iengkhawm ngai loin, a thlâwnin suok el a tih.

en: If he come in by himself, he shall go out by himself: if he be married, then his wife shall go out with him.
hmr: Ama khâta hung lût a ni chun, ama khâtin suok nâwk el a ta; nuhmei nei tah a ni chun a nuhmei khawm ama leh suok vêng a tih.

en: If his master give him a wife and she bear him sons or daughters; the wife and her children shall be her master’s, and he shall go out by himself.
hmr: A hotupa chun nuhmei a pêk a, a nuhmei chun naupasalhai le naunu- hmeihai a neipêk chun,nuhmei le a nauhai chu a hotupa ta nîng an ta; ama khâtin suok el a tih.

en: But if the servant shall plainly say, I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, siehlaw chun, Ka hotupa, ka nuhmei le ka nauhai ka hmangai a, zalêna um dingin suok da el ka tih, a ti chun:

en: then his master shall bring him unto God, and shall bring him to the door, or unto the door-post; and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl; and he shall serve him for ever.
hmr: a hotupa chun Pathien kuomah hung ṭhuoi a ta, kawtkhâr bienga manih, kawtkhâra manih hung ṭhuoi a ta; a hotupa chun a nakâwr chu thîr zumin ver tlang a ta, kumkhuoin ama rawng chu bâwl tâng a tih.

en: And if a man sell his daughter to be a maid-servant, she shall not go out as the men-servants do.
hmr: “Miin a naunuhmei siehlawnu ni dinga a zawr chun, siehlawpahai suok angin chu minu chu suok thei naw nih.

en: If she please not her master, who hath espoused her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell her unto a foreign people he shall have no power, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully with her.
hmr: A hotupa a suklungawi nawh a, ama chun nei dinga a huol naw chun, intlanin inumtir a tih: amânu chu indiklotaka a lo thaw tâk leiin, ram dang mi kuoma zawr sâwng dingin thuneina nei thei naw nih.

en: And if he espouse her unto his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.
hmr: A naupa nuhmei dinga a huol a ni chun, ama chu naunuhmeihai ang bawkin a thaw ding a nih.

en: If he take him another wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage, shall he not diminish.
hmr: Nuhmei dang ân neitir chun, a bu, a silfên le inneinaa a chan chu a suktlâwmpêk chuong ding a ni nawh.

en: And if he do not these three things unto her, then shall she go out for nothing, without money.
hmr: Hi thil pathum hi chu minu chunga a thaw naw chun, tangka loin, iengkhawm ngai loin fe suok el a tih.

en: He that smiteth a man, so that he dieth, shall surely be put to death.
hmr: “Miin mi dang a vuok a, a thi chun, ama khawm chu sukhlum ngei ding a nih.

en: And if a man lie not in wait, but God deliver him into his hand; then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tum hrimnaa inchân lei ni lo a, Pathienin ama chu a kuta a pêk hrim a ni chun, tlân hmangna ding hmun ruotpêk ka ti che.

en: And if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbor, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.
hmr: Miin a vênghai tum hrimnaa hlêma sukhlum tuma a thaw ruok chun, ama chu sukhlum dingin ka mâichâma inthawkin ṭhuoi hmang i tih.

en: And he that smiteth his father, or his mother, shall be surely put to death.
hmr: “Tukhawm a nu manih, a pa manih vawtu chu sukhlum ngei ding a nih.

en: And he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, or if he be found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.
hmr: “Tukhawm mihriem inru chu, a zawr khawmin, amain a umpui a ni khawmin, ama chu sukhlum ngei ding a nih.

en: And he that curseth his father or his mother, shall surely be put to death.
hmr: “Tukhawm a pa manih, a nu manih ṭawngsieinphurtu chu sukhlum ngei ding a nih.

en: And if men contend, and one smite the other with a stone, or with his fist, and he die not, but keep his bed;
hmr: Mi insuol hai sienla, mi pakhat- in mi dang lunga dêngin amanih, a kuttumin amanih chum sienla, ama chu thi loin, tho kâng pei loin zâl el sienla;

en: if he rise again, and walk abroad upon his staff, then shall he that smote him be quit: only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.
hmr: a hung tho nâwk a, hmawl ṭhuna a lâwn thei chun, a vawtu chu insuo phawt ding a nih; a hun sukhmang ai chu thung a ta, a dam var chenin enkawl a tih.

en: And if a man smite his servant, or his maid, with a rod, and he die under his hand; he shall surely be punished.
hmr: “Miin a siehlawpa amanih, a siehlawnu amanih hmawlin vaw sien, thi dêr sienla, ama chu hrem ngei ding a nih.

en: Notwithstanding, if he continue a day or two, he shall not be punished: for he is his money.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ni khat am- anih, ni hni amanih a la dam chun, ama chu hrem ding a ni nawh; siehlaw chu a tangka a ni leiin.

en: And if men strive together, and hurt a woman with child, so that her fruit depart, and yet no harm follow; he shall be surely fined, according as the woman’s husband shall lay upon him; and he shall pay as the judges determine.
hmr: “Mi an insuol a, nuhmei nau vawn a suknah a, a nau chu a tla chun, sietnain hung zui kher naw sien khawm, chu nuhmeinu pasalin a chunga a phût zât ang ang chu inchawitir ngei ding a nih: chun, rorêltuhaiin ṭha an ti ang chu a pêk ding a nih.

en: But if any harm follow, then thou shalt give life for life,
hmr: Sietnain a hung zui hlau ruok chun hringna aiah hringna,

en: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
hmr: mit aiah mit, ha aiah ha, kut aiah kut, ke aiah ke,

en: burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
hmr: raw aiah raw, sukhliem aiah sukhliem, vuok aiah vuok pe ve thung i tih.

en: And if a man smite the eye of his servant, or the eye of his maid, and destroy it; he shall let him go free for his eye’s sake.
hmr: “Miin a siehlawpa mit amanih, a siehlawnu mit amanih a vuok a, a suksiet chun, a mit lei chun ama chu iengkhawm ngai loin insuoktir el a tih.

en: And if he smite out his man-servant’s tooth, or his maid-servant’s tooth, he shall let him go free for his tooth’s sake.
hmr: A siehlawpa ha amanih, a siehlawnu ha amanih a vuok thlawng chun, a ha lei chun iengkhawm ngai loin insuoktir el a tih.

en: And if an ox gore a man or a woman to death, the ox shall be surely stoned, and its flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be quit.
hmr: “Bâwngchalin pasal amanih, nuhmei a sik a, a thi chun, chu bâwngchal chu lunga dêng hlum ngei ding a na, a sa chu fâk a ni ding a ni nawh; bâwngchal neitu ruok chu fihlîm a tih.

en: But if the ox was wont to gore in time past, and it hath been testified to its owner, and he hath not kept it in, but it hath killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and its owner also shall be put to death.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, bâwngchal chu a hma khawmin mi sik hmangtak lo ni tahin, a neitu khawm chu inhriet- tir lo ni ta bawk sienla, ama chun a inah a thlung nawh a, pasal amanih, nuhmei a sukhlum a ni chun, a neitu chu sukhlum nîng a ta, bâwgchal khawm chu dêng hlum ni bawk a tih.

en: If there be laid on him a ransom, then he shall give for the redemption of his life whatsoever is laid upon him.
hmr: Ama chu intlanna phût a ni chun, a hringna ta dinga intlanna a kuoma phût ang taphawt chu pêng a tih.

en: Whether it have gored a son, or have gored a daughter, according to this judgment shall it be done unto him.
hmr: Naupa amanih, naunu sik a ni khawmin hi dân bawk hi a chungah hmang nîng a tih.

en: If the ox gore a man-servant or a maid-servant, there shall be given unto their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
hmr: Bâwngchalin siehlawpa am- anih, siehlawnu a sik chun, a neitu chun an hotupa kuoma chun shekel tangka sâwmthum pêng a ta, chun, bâwngchal chu dêng hlum nîng a tih.

en: And if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit and not cover it, and an ox or an ass fall therein,
hmr: “Miin khur hawngin amanih, miin khur choin nel nâwk naw sienla, chutaka chun sabengtung amanih, bâwngchal tla ta sienla,

en: the owner of the pit shall make it good; he shall give money unto the owner thereof, and the dead beast shall be his.
hmr: a khur neitu chun thung a ta; a ran neitu kuoma chun tangka pêng a ta, ran thi chu ama ta ni tâng a tih.

en: And if one man’s ox hurt another’s, so that it dieth, then they shall sell the live ox, and divide the price of it; and the dead also they shall divide.
hmr: “Mi pakhat bâwngchalin mi dang bâwngchal suknain lo thi ta sienla, bâwngchal la dam chu zawr an ta, a man chu insem an tih; chun, a thi khawm chu insem bawk an tih.

en: Or if it be known that the ox was wont to gore in time past, and its owner hath not kept it in; he shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead beast shall be his own.
hmr: Bâwngchal chu a hma khawma mi sik hmang a ni ti hriet sa a ni ruok chun, a neituin a inah a thlung naw a ni chun, bâwngchal aia chun bâwngchal ma a pêk ngei ding a nih; chun, ran thi chu ama ta ni tâng a tih.

en: If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall pay five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
hmr: “Miin bâwngchal amanih, berâm inru sienla, lo zawrin amanih lo that sienla; bâwngchal pakhat aia chun bâwngchal panga pêng a ta, berâm pakhat aia chun berâm pali a pêk ding a nih.

en: If the thief be found breaking in, and be smitten so that he dieth, there shall be no bloodguiltiness for him.
hmr: Inru chu ina a lût lai hmuin, vuokin lo thi ta sienla, ama chunga chun thisen phuba um naw nih.

en: If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be bloodguiltiness for him; he shall make restitution: if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
hmr: Ama chunga chun nisa a suok ta chun, ama ta dingin thisen phuba chu um a tih. Inru chun a thung ngei ding a nih. Iengkhawm a nei naw chun ama chu iengkhat inrûk mana zawr ding a nih.

en: If the theft be found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep, he shall pay double.
hmr: A thil inrûk chu, bâwngchal amanih, sabengtung amanih, berâm amanih a hringa a kuta hmu a ni chun, a lêthni peiin thung a tih.

en: If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall let his beast loose, and it feed in another man’s field; of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard, shall he make restitution.
hmr: “Miin lo amanih, grêp huon infâktirin, annawleh, a ran chu insuoin mi dang loah intlattir sienla; a lo laia a ṭha tak le, a grêp huon laia a ṭha takin thung a tih.

en: If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the shocks of grain, or the standing grain, or the field are consumed; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
hmr: “Mei a suok a, ṭhûlah a kâng mat pei a, bu hlum amanih, buvui ngîr lai amanih, lo amanih a kâng hmang chun, mei insuotu chun a thung ngei ding a nih.

en: If a man shall deliver unto his neighbor money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man’s house; if the thief be found, he shall pay double.
hmr: “Miin a vênghai kuomah tangka amanih, bûrlebêl kawl dinga a pêk a, chu mipa ina inthawka inrûk a nih a, ân rutu chu man a ni chun, a lêt hniin a thung ngei ding a nih.

en: If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall come near unto God, to see whether he have not put his hand unto his neighbor’s goods.
hmr: Inru chu man a ni naw chun, a in neitu chun a vênghai thuomhnaw chunga chun kutkem a lo hmang le hmang naw fie dingin Pathien kuomah a hung ding a nih.

en: For every matter of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, whereof one saith, This is it, the cause of both parties shall come before God; he whom God shall condemn shall pay double unto his neighbor.
hmr: Thil inhmang thubuoi tinah, bâwngchal khawm, sabengtung khawm, berâm khawm, silfên khawm, thil inhmang ieng ienga khawm, mi pakhatin, ‘Hi hi a nih,’ a ti phawt chun, a khingtuokhai ve ve chu Pathien hmaah hung an ta, Pathienin ân thiemnaw chun a vêngpa kuoma chun a lêt hniin thung a tih.

en: If a man deliver unto his neighbor an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it:
hmr: “Miin a vênghai kuomah sa- bengtung amanih, bâwngchal am- anih, berâm amanih ran hrim hrim enkawl dingin sie sienla, lo thiin amanih, suknatin amanih, khal hmangin lo umin, mi tukhawmin hmu naw hai sien,

en: the oath of Jehovah shall be between them both, whether he hath not put his hand unto his neighbor’s goods; and the owner thereof shall accept it, and he shall not make restitution.
hmr: a vênghai thuomhnawhai chungah kutkem a hmang le hmang naw, LALPA hmaa inkhâmna chu an inkârah um ve vêng a ta, chu chu a ran neitu khawm chun pawm a ta; a thung ṭûl naw nih.

en: But if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, amaa inthawk- a inrûk hmang a ni chun, a ran neitu chu a thung ding a nih.

en: If it be torn in pieces, let him bring it for witness: he shall not make good that which was torn.
hmr: Ramsa ikeinâwi vawng amanih a lo ni chun, hrietfiena dingin hung lâng a ta, keinâwia um ta hnung chu thung ta naw nih.

en: And if a man borrow aught of his neighbor, and it be hurt, or die, the owner thereof not being with it, he shall surely make restitution.
hmr: “Miin a vênghai ran iengkhawm haw sienla, lo thi amanih, inhliem lo ni sienla, a neitu ṭhanglo a ni chun, a thung ngei ding a nih.

en: If the owner thereof be with it, he shall not make it good: if it be a hired thing, it came for its hire.
hmr: A neitu a ṭhang ruok chun, thung chuong naw nih a; man neia haw a ni chun haw a ni dân dân chun fêng a tih.

en: And if a man entice a virgin that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely pay a dowry for her to be his wife.
hmr: “Miin nunghâk inthieng huol la ni lo, thlemin lo zâlpui sienla, a man pêng a ta, a nei ngei ding a nih.

en: If her father utterly refuse to give her unto him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
hmr: “A pa chun ama chu a pêk nuom dêr naw chun, nunghâk man ang hu tangka a pek tho ding a nih.

en: Thou shalt not suffer a sorceress to live.
hmr: “Dawithiemnu chu a hring i phal ding a ni nawh.

en: Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.
hmr: “Tukhawm ran rîm taphawt chu sukhlum a ni ngei ding a nih.

en: He that sacrificeth unto any god, save unto Jehovah only, shall be utterly destroyed.
hmr: “LALPA ti chau lo pathien dang hrim hrim kuoma inthâwi chu sukbohmang dêr nîng a tih.

en: And a sojourner shalt thou not wrong, neither shalt thou oppress him: for ye were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
hmr: Mikhuol chu indiknawtakin i thaw ding a ni nawh a, i suknawmna ding khawm a ni nawh; nang khawm Aiguptaah mikhuol i ni ta kha.

en: Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
hmr: Hmeithai amanih, fahra chu i sukrimsi ding a ni nawh.

en: If thou afflict them at all, and they cry at all unto me, I will surely hear their cry;
hmr: Ieng kawnga khawm i suk- rimsih a, kei an mi hung ko phawt chun, an mi kona lo hre ngei ngei ka ta;

en: and my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
hmr: ka lunginsenna chu hung lum a ta, kâwlhnâmin that ka ti cheh a; i nuhmei chu hmeithai nîng a ta; i nauhai chu fahra nîng an tih.

en: If thou lend money to any of my people with thee that is poor, thou shalt not be to him as a creditor; neither shall ye lay upon him interest.
hmr: “I kuoma ka mihai pasie tukhawm kuomah tangka în pûktir chun, a chunga chun lei inbattirtu ang i ni ding a ni nawh a; ama chunga chun a pung i hnawt kher ding a ni nawh.

en: If thou at all take thy neighbor’s garment to pledge, thou shalt restore it unto him before the sun goeth down:
hmr: “I vênghai silfên tiemkama i lâk chun nisa tlâk hmain i pêk nâwk ngei ding a nih;

en: for that is his only covering, it is his garment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth unto me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.
hmr: chu chu a puonsil neisun a nih a, a taksa inkhumna dinga a puon chu a nih; khâwlai am zâl tâng a ta? Chun, kei a mi hung ko pha lo hrieng ka tih, mi lunginsiettheitak ka ni sih a.

en: Thou shalt not revile God, nor curse a ruler of thy people.
hmr: “Pathien i hrilsiet ding a ni nawh a, i mihai rorêltu khawm chu ṭawngsie în phur ding a ni bawk nawh.

en: Thou shalt not delay to offer of thy harvest, and of the outflow of thy presses. The first-born of thy sons shalt thou give unto me.
hmr: “I sinthaw ra po poa dâwnmihai le fâkmihaia ra hmasa tak chu în hlân inhnu ding a ni nawh. I naupasalhaia nau lutîr chu i mi pêk ding a nih.

en: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with its dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it me.
hmr: Chuong ang bawk chun i bâwngchalhai, i berâmhai i thaw ding a nih; ni sari chu a pui leh um an ta, ni riet ni chun ka kuomah i pêk ding a nih.

en: And ye shall be holy men unto me: therefore ye shall not eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.
hmr: “Ka kuoma chun mi inthieng nîng in ta, chuongchun, ramsahai fâk hnung sa hrim hrim chu fa naw ti niu a, uihai kuomah pe lem in tih.

en: Thou shalt not take up a false report: put not thy hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
hmr: “Thuthang indiknaw chu hril dar naw la, hrietpuitu felnaw ni dingin mi rilo inthlawppui naw rawh.

en: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to turn aside after a multitude to wrest justice:
hmr: Thil suol thaw dingin mipui chu i zui ding a ni nawh a; indikna keikâwi dinga mi tamna tieng tienga ṭhangin thubuoiah hrietpuitu i ni ding a ni bawk nawh;

en: neither shalt thou favor a poor man in his cause.
hmr: mi pasie khawm chu a thubuoiah i ditsak bîk ding a ni nawh.

en: If thou meet thine enemy’s ox or his ass going astray, thou shalt surely bring it back to him again.
hmr: “I hmêlma bâwngchal amanih, sabengtung fe hmang ding în tuokpui chun, ama kuomah i hung ṭhuoi kîr ngei ding a nih.

en: If thou see the ass of him that hateth thee lying under his burden, thou shalt forbear to leave him, thou shalt surely release it with him.
hmr: Nangma theidatu che sa- bengtung chu a phurrik hnuoia zâlin, insuo dinga i ṭhangpui ṭul a ni chun, ama chu în suopui ngei ding a nih.

en: Thou shalt not wrest the justice due to thy poor in his cause.
hmr: “I mi pasie thubuoi rêlnaah indikna în hmang ding a ni nawh.

en: Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.
hmr: Hêkna indik nawa inthawk chu insiekieng dai la, pawitâwklo le mi fel chu that naw rawh, a thiemnaw chu thiem kân changtir âwm si nawh a.

en: And thou shalt take no bribe: for a bribe blindeth them that have sight, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
hmr: Chun, thamna i lâk ding a ni nawh, thamna chun hmutheina nei- hai khawm an mit a sukdel a, mi fel thuhai khawm a keikâwi hlak sih a.

en: And a sojourner shalt thou not oppress: for ye know the heart of a sojourner, seeing ye were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
hmr: Hnam dang chu i nêksâwr ding a ni nawh; nangni khawm Aigupta ramah hnam dang in ni kha hrein, hnam dang lungril chu in hriet sih a.

en: And six years thou shalt sow thy land, and shalt gather in the increase thereof:
hmr: “Kum ruk sûng chu i ramah chi tûng i ta, chu sûng chun a rahai chu la khâwm i tih;

en: but the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and lie fallow; that the poor of thy people may eat: and what they leave the beast of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with thy vineyard, and with thy oliveyard.
hmr: kum sarinaa ruok chun in- châwltirin inumtir ṭawk ṭawk i tih, i mi pasiehaiin an fâk theina dingin le, an mâksanhai chu ramsahaiin an fâk theina dingin. Chuong ang bawkin, i grêp huonhai le i oliv huonhai chu thâwng i tih.

en: Six days thou shalt do thy work, and on the seventh day thou shalt rest; that thine ox and thine ass may have rest, and the son of thy handmaid, and the sojourner, may be refreshed.
hmr: Ni ruk sûng chu i sin thâwng i ta, ni sari ni ruok chun i bâwngchal le i sabengtung khawm chu an sâwldam theina ding le, i ina pieng i siehlawnu naupa le hnam dang mi khawm chu an insukhar theina dingin i châwl ding a nih.

en: And in all things that I have said unto you take ye heed: and make no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out of thy mouth.
hmr: I kuoma ka hril ta po po hi pawisa la, pathien danghai hming hrim chu lam naw la, i baua inthawkin hriet khawm ni bawk naw raw se.

en: Three times thou shalt keep a feast unto me in the year.
hmr: “Kum khat sûngin ka kuomah ruoiṭhena ṭum thum i nei ding a nih.

en: The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep: seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, at the time appointed in the month Abib (for in it thou camest out from Egypt); and none shall appear before me empty:
hmr: Chawl ṭhanglo bei ruoi i nei ding a na, ni sari sûng chawl ṭhanglo bei fâng i ta, thu ka pêk ang cheha, Abib thlaha hun ka ruotpêk che huna khan (chu thla chun Aiguptaa inthawkin i hung suok a ni sih a) chun, tukhawm ka hmaah kut ruokin an hung inlang ding an nawh.

en: and the feast of harvest, the first-fruits of thy labors, which thou sowest in the field: and the feast of ingathering, at the end of the year, when thou gatherest in thy labors out of the field.
hmr: Loa i chîng i sininrimna ra hmasahai sîk hunah Busîk ruoi le, kum tâwpah loa inthawka i sinthaw rahai po po i lâk khâwm vawng pha Pâwltlâk ruoi i nei bawk ding a nih.

en: Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the Lord Jehovah.
hmr: Kum khatah ṭum thum pasal po po LALPA Pathien hmaah an hung inlang ding a nih.

en: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my feast remain all night until the morning.
hmr: “Ka inthâwina thisen chu chawl ṭhang leh în hlân ding a ni nawh a; ka ruoiṭhena sathâu chu zânkhawvâr, zîngkâr chenin a um zing ding a ni bawk nawh.

en: The first of the first-fruits of thy ground thou shalt bring into the house of Jehovah thy God. Thou shalt not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
hmr: I hnuoi ra hmasatak laia a ṭha tak chu LALPA i Pathien ina chun i hung lâk ding a nih. Kêlte chu a pui nênetuiah i suong ding a ni nawh.

en: Behold, I send an angel before thee, to keep thee by the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
hmr: “Ngai ta, i lampuia enkawl ding che le, hmun ka buotsaia chun ṭhuoi ding chein i hmaah vântirko ka tir a nih.

en: Take ye heed before him, and hearken unto his voice; provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgression: for my name is in him.
hmr: Ama chu pawisa unla, a râwl chu ngai unla, suklungsen naw ro; ka hming chu amaa chun a um a, in bawsietnahai chu a ngaidam naw ding cheu a ni sih a.

en: But if thou shalt indeed hearken unto his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama râwl chu i ngai tak tak a, ka hril po po hi i thaw chun, i hmêlmahai ta dingin hmêlma nîng ka ta, i khingpuihai ta dingin an khingpui nîng ka tih.

en: For mine angel shall go before thee, and bring thee in unto the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Canaanite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite: and I will cut them off.
hmr: Ka vântirko chu i hmaah fêng a ta, Amor mihai le, Hit mihai le, Periz mihai le, Kanaan mihai le, Hiv mihai le, Jebus mihai rama chun ṭhuoi lût a ti che; chun, anni chu tan thlâng ka tih.

en: Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works; but thou shalt utterly overthrow them, and break in pieces their pillars.
hmr: An pathienhai kuoma chun i kûn ding a ni nawh a, an rawng khawm i bâwl ding a ni nawh a, an sin i thaw ding a ni bawk nawh; anni chu peithla letdêr i ta, an milimhai chu suknâwi vawng i tih.

en: And ye shall serve Jehovah your God, and he will bless thy bread, and thy water; and I will take sickness away from the midst of thee.
hmr: LALPA i Pathien rawng chu bâwl i ta, i tui le beia khawm mal sâwmpêk ka ti che; chun, nangmaa inthawkin natnahai chu la hmang bawk ka tih.

en: There shall none cast her young, nor be barren, in thy land: the number of thy days I will fulfil.
hmr: “I ram sûngah ching le mâni nau ṭhe tukhawm um naw ni hai a, i dam sûng nihai chu sukkim ka tih.

en: I will send my terror before thee, and will discomfit all the people to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thine enemies turn their backs unto thee.
hmr: Ka ṭitumna chu i hmaah tir ka ta, mi an kuoma i hungna dinghai chu sukbohmang ka ta, i hmêlmahai chu hnung innghat ding chein siem ka tih.

en: And I will send the hornet before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before thee.
hmr: I hmaah khuoi tûrnei tir ka ta, chuongchun, Hiv mihai, Kanaan mi- hai, Hit mihai chu i hmaha inthawkin hnawt suok an tih.

en: I will not drive them out from before thee in one year, lest the land become desolate, and the beasts of the field multiply against thee.
hmr: I hmaha inthawkin kum khat sûngin hnawt suok vawng naw ning, chuong naw chun ram chu râusan nîng a ta, ram sahai i chungah hung ṭuong rawi an tih.

en: By little and little I will drive them out from before thee, until thou be increased, and inherit the land.
hmr: I hung pung a, ram chu i hluo thei zet hmakhat chu anni chu tlawmte têin i hmaha inthawkin hnawt suok hret hret ka tih.

en: And I will set thy border from the Red Sea even unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness unto the River: for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand: and thou shalt drive them out before thee.
hmr: Tuipui Sena inthawka Philistin tuipui chen le, thlalêra inthawka Euphrates vadung chenin i ramri chu khang ka ta; a ram hluotuhai chu i kutah ka pêk ding che a ni sih a; chun, nangin i hmaha inthawkin hnawt suok i tih.

en: Thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
hmr: “An pathienhai leh amanih, anni leh amani khawm thuthlung hrim i siem ding a ni nawh.

en: They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee sin against me; for if thou serve their gods, it will surely be a snare unto thee.
hmr: I ram sûngah an um ding a ni nawh a, chuong naw chun ka chungah insuksuoltir rawi an ti che; an pathienhai rawng i bâwl chun, i ta dingin châng a ni ngei ngei ding a ni sih a, tiin” a tih a.

en: And he said unto Moses, Come up unto Jehovah, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off:
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah “Nang le Aron, Nadab le Abihu le, Israel upahai sâwmsari leh LALPA kuomah hung ro; chun, hlataka inthawkin chibai bûk ro.

en: and Moses alone shall come near unto Jehovah; but they shall not come near; neither shall the people go up with him.
hmr: LALPA kâwl hnaia chu Mosie khâtin hung sienla, mi danghai ruok chu hung hnai naw hai sien, mipui chu ama ruolin hang fe bawk naw raw hai se,” a tih a.

en: And Moses came and told the people all the words of Jehovah, and all the ordinances: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which Jehovah hath spoken will we do.
hmr: Mosie chu a hung a, LALPA thu po po le dânhai po po chu mipui a hril tah a. Mipui po po chun thu thu- hmunin an dawn a, “LALPAIN thu a hril po po chu thâwng kan tih,” an tih a.

en: And Moses wrote all the words of Jehovah, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the mount, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
hmr: Mosie chun LALPA thuhai po po chu a ziek a, zîngkâr inhmatakin a tho a; tlâng hnuoia chun mâichâm le lungphun sâwmpahni, Israel hnam sâwmpahni aiawin a phun tah a.

en: And he sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered burnt-offerings, and sacrificed peace-offerings of oxen unto Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Israel thla tlangvâlhai chu a tir a, LALPA kuomah rawhmang thilinhlân an inhlân a, inremna thilinhlân dingin bâwngchalin an inthâwi bawk a.

en: And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basins; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
hmr: Mosie chun a thisen zâtna chu a lâk a, maihûnhaiah a sieh a; a thisen zâtna dang chu mâichâma chun a theh a.

en: And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that Jehovah hath spoken will we do, and be obedient.
hmr: Chun, thuthlungna lekhabu chu a lâk a, mipui hrieta chun a tiem tah a; anni chun, “LALPAIN a hril taphawt chu thâwng kan ta, thu- awitakin um kan tih,” an tih a.

en: And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which Jehovah hath made with you concerning all these words.
hmr: Chun, Mosie chun thisen chu a lâk a, mipui chu a theh a, “Hieng thuhai po po chungthua LALPAIN thisen thuthlung a siempêk cheu hi en ta u,” a tih a.

en: Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel:
hmr: Chun, Mosie le Aron, Nadab, Abihu le, Israel upa sâwmsari chu an hang feh a;

en: and they saw the God of Israel; and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of sapphire stone, and as it were the very heaven for clearness.
hmr: chun, Israel Pathien chu an hmuh a, a kehai hnuoia chun sapphir lung rem ang tletak, a tlêtzie chu vân thil ni âwm tak hrim hi a um a.

en: And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: and they beheld God, and did eat and drink.
hmr: Israel thla miṭhahai chungah a kut ân nghat nawh a; Pathien chu an hmu ngei a, an fâkin an dâwn a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee the tables of stone, and the law and the commandment, which I have written, that thou mayest teach them.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Tlângah ka kuomah hung la, chutaka chun um rawh; dân le thupêk le anni inchûktirna dinga ka ziekhai, lung phêk pahni chu pêng ka ti che,” a tih a.

en: And Moses rose up, and Joshua his minister: and Moses went up into the mount of God.
hmr: Mosie le a rawngbâwltu Josua chu an tho a, Mosie chu Pathien tlânga chun a hang fe tah a.

en: And he said unto the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again unto you: and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: whosoever hath a cause, let him come near unto them.
hmr: Upahai kuoma chun, “Hitaka hin keini mi lo nghâk ro, in kuoma kan hung nâwk hmakhat chu: chun, ngai ta u, Aron le Hur hi in kuomah an um a, tukhawm thubuoi nei chun an kuomah lo fe raw se,” a tih a.

en: And Moses went up into the mount, and the cloud covered the mount.
hmr: Chun, Mosie chu tlânga chun a hang feh a, tlâng chu sûmin ân khum tah a.

en: And the glory of Jehovah abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
hmr: LALPA ropuina chu Sinai tlânga chun a um zing a, ni ruk sûng sûmin ân khum a; ni sari ni chun sûm laia inthawk chun Mosie a ko tah a.

en: And the appearance of the glory of Jehovah was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the children of Israel.
hmr: Israel thlahai mita LALPA ropuina inlang dân chu, tlâng sîpa chun kânghmangna meichawk ang a nih.

en: And Moses entered into the midst of the cloud, and went up into the mount: and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
hmr: Mosie chu sûm zîng hnuoia chun a lût a, tlânga chun a hang fe tah a. Mosie chu ni sâwmli le zân sâwmli tlânga chun a um tah a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah,

en: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they take for me an offering: of every man whose heart maketh him willing ye shall take my offering.
hmr: “Israel thlahai kuoma chun hril la, ka ta dingin thilpêk dâwl raw hai se; mi tin a lungrila inhâwktaka petua inthawkin ka ta dinga thilpêk chu in lâk ding a nih.

en: And this is the offering which ye shall take of them: gold, and silver, and brass,
hmr: Hieng hi annia inthawka thilpêk in lâk dinghai chu a nih; rângkachak, tangkaruo le dârsen leh,

en: and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats’ hair,
hmr: sahmul dumpâwl, a êm le seninlâr le patzai inhmi thlûr, kêl hmul,

en: and rams’ skins dyed red, and sealskins, and acacia wood,
hmr: berâmchal vun suksen, seal vunhai le shittim thing leh;

en: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,
hmr: meivar dingin hriek, riminhnik, râwmi ding le innâlna hriek dingin riminhnik,

en: onyx stones, and stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate.
hmr: Onik lung le lunghai thiempu zakawsîng le a âwma bel ding leh nîng a tih.

en: And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.
hmr: Chun, hmun inthieng mi siem- pêk raw hai se, anni laia ka um zing theina dingin.

en: According to all that I show thee, the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all the furniture thereof, even so shall ye make it.
hmr: Biekbûk riruot le a thuom- hnawhai riruot kân entir che po po ang tak hin in bâwl ding a nih.

en: And they shall make an ark of acacia wood: two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
hmr: “Shittim thingin Thuthlung bâwm siem an ta; a seitieng tawng hni le a chenve, a lientieng tawng khat le a chenve, ân sângtieng tawng khat le a chenve bawk ning a tih.

en: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without shalt thou overlay it, and shalt make upon it a crown of gold round about.
hmr: Rângkachak inthiengin inluon khum i ta; a sûng le puo inluon khum i tih; a chunga chun a vêlin râng- kachakin a tlâng kâwm i tih.

en: And thou shalt cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in the four feet thereof; and two rings shall be on the one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.
hmr: Rângkachak kuol pali sut i ta, a kehai palia chun inbûk i tih; kuol hni chu a sîr khatah um an ta, kuol hni dang chu a sîr khingtiengah um an tih.

en: And thou shalt make staves of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
hmr: Shittim thing zâwnfunghai siem i ta, rângkachak inluon khum i tih.

en: And thou shalt put the staves into the rings on the sides of the ark, wherewith to bear the ark.
hmr: “Thuthlung bâwm sîra a kuol sûnghaia chun Thuthlung bâwm zâwnna ding chun rawl i tih.

en: The staves shall be in the rings of the ark: they shall not be taken from it.
hmr: Zâwnfunghai chu Thuthlung bâwma a kuolhai sûnga chun um zing an tih, lâk suok an ni hrim hrim ding a ni nawh.

en: And thou shalt put into the ark the testimony which I shall give thee.
hmr: Thuthlung bâwm sûnga chun thuthlung ka pêk ding che chu sieng i tih.

en: And thou shalt make a mercy-seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
hmr: Chun rângkachak inthiengin zângaina ṭhungpha siem i ta, a sei- tieng tawng hni le a chenve, a lientieng tawng khat le a chenvein.

en: And thou shalt make two cherubim of gold; of beaten work shalt thou make them, at the two ends of the mercy-seat.
hmr: Rângkachak cherub pahni a suta sutin, zângaina ṭhungpha hmawr ve veah sieng i tih.

en: And make one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end: of one piece with the mercy-seat shall ye make the cherubim on the two ends thereof.
hmr: Cherub pakhat chu a hmawr khingkhatah, cherub pakhat dang chu a hmawr khingtiengah siem i tih; a hmawr pahni tâwpa cherubhai chu zângaina ṭhungpha le hlûm khata inthawkin siem i tih.

en: And the cherubim shall spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy-seat with their wings, with their faces one to another; toward the mercy-seat shall the faces of the cherubim be.
hmr: Cherubhai chun chungtieng an thla zar an ta, an thlahai chun zângaina ṭhungpha chu zar hlieng an ta, an hmaihai chu innghattuok ve vein, cherubhai chun zângaina ṭhungpha tieng chu nghâng an tih.

en: And thou shalt put the mercy-seat above upon the ark; and in the ark thou shalt put the testimony that I shall give thee.
hmr: Chun, Thuthlung bâwm chunga chun zângaina ṭhungpha chu sieng i ta; chun, Thuthlung bâwm sûnga chun thuthlung ka pêk ding che chu sieng i tih.

en: And there I will meet with thee, and I will commune with thee from above the mercy-seat, from between the two cherubim which are upon the ark of the testimony, of all things which I will give thee in commandment unto the children of Israel.
hmr: Chutaka chun intuokpui ka ti cheh a, Israel thlahai kuoma thupêk kawnga thil ka pêk ding che po po chu, Thuthlung bâwm chunga zângaina ṭhungpha chunga inthawk chun hung inhriettir ka ti che.

en: And thou shalt make a table of acacia wood: two cubits shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
hmr: “Shittim thingin dawkân siem i ta; a seitieng tawng hni, a lientieng tawng khat, ân sângtieng chu tawng khat le a chenve nîng a tih.

en: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, and make thereto a crown of gold round about.
hmr: Rângkachak inthiengin inluon khum i ta, a vêlin rângkachakin a tlâng kâwm i tih.

en: And thou shalt make unto it a border of a handbreadth round about; and thou shalt make a golden crown to the border thereof round about.
hmr: A vêlin kutphabawkin a rei siem i ta, chu rei chu a vêlin rângkachakin inluon i tih.

en: And thou shalt make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that are on the four feet thereof.
hmr: Chu ta ding chun rângkachak kuol pali siem i ta, chu kuolhai chu a kil palia a ke palia chun inbûk i ta;

en: Close by the border shall the rings be, for places for the staves to bear the table.
hmr: Dawkân zâwnna zâwnfunghai rawlna dingin a kuolhai chu a rei hnaiah an um ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make the staves of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be borne with them.
hmr: Dawkân zâwnna ding chun shit- tim thing zâwnfunghai siem i ta; rângkachakin inluon khum i tih.

en: And thou shalt make the dishes thereof, and the spoons thereof, and the flagons thereof, and the bowls thereof, wherewith to pour out: of pure gold shalt thou make them.
hmr: A thlênghai, haihawhai, notung seihai, noinkûmhai, dâwn mi thilin- hlân bun suokna dingin siem i tih: chuong chu rângkachak inthiengin i siem ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt set upon the table showbread before me alway.
hmr: Chun, ka hmaah dawkân chung- a chun entirna bei sie rawp i tih.

en: And thou shalt make a candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work shall the candlestick be made, even its base, and its shaft; its cups, its knops, and its flowers, shall be of one piece with it:
hmr: “Chun rângkachak inthiengin sathâukhâwnvar siena siem i tih. Sathâukhâwnvar chu zawm khat vawng a ni ding a nih; a nohai, a mûmhai le a hmawr pârhai chu hlûm khat vawnga inthawka siem a ni ding a nih.

en: and there shall be six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:
hmr: Chu khâwnvar siena ngul chun kâu paruk nei a ta, sîr khata chun sathâukhâwnvar siena kâu thum, a sîr khingtiengah sathâukhâwnvar siena kâu thum bawk;

en: three cups made like almond-blossoms in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three cups made like almond-blossoms in the other branch, a knop and a flower: so for the six branches going out of the candlestick:
hmr: kau khata chun almond zîk anga siem khei pathum, amûm le a hmawr pâr um, a kâu danga chun almond zîk anga siem khei pathum, amûm le a hmawr pârhai um a tih; sathâukhâwnvar siena kâu hung suok, a kâu parukhai chu chuong ang seng chu an nih.

en: and in the candlestick four cups made like almond-blossoms, the knops thereof, and the flowers thereof;
hmr: Chun, sathâukhâwnvar siena ngula almond zîkhai anga siem no pali, a mûmhai le a hmawr pârhai leh um a tih.

en: and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of the candlestick.
hmr: Chun, sathâukhâwnvar siena ngula kâu paruk ṭo suokhaia kâu hni tuok hnuoi peiah a mûm pakhat um pei bawkin.

en: Their knops and their branches shall be of one piece with it; the whole of it one beaten work of pure gold.
hmr: A hmawr pârhai le an kâuhai chu zawm khat an ni ding a nih a, a pumpui chun rângkachak inthieng sutzawm vawng a ni ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make the lamps thereof, seven: and they shall light the lamps thereof, to give light over against it.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun khâwn- varhai pasari siem i ta, an umna hmazâwn hmun ruok elvar dinga inṭhut nîng an tih.

en: And the snuffers thereof, and the snuffdishes thereof, shall be of pure gold.
hmr: A chaichehai le a vâmdawhai khawm chu rângkachak inthienga siem an ni ding a nih.

en: Of a talent of pure gold shall it be made, with all these vessels.
hmr: Rângkachak inthieng talent khat bûka siem ding a nih, hieng a bûrlebêl po pohai le hin.

en: And see that thou make them after their pattern, which hath been showed thee in the mount.
hmr: Chun, a riruot tlâng chunga inentir i ni angtak khan i siem ngei ding a nih.

en: Moreover thou shalt make the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, with cherubim the work of the skilful workman shalt thou make them.
hmr: “Chu nawa khawm biekbûk chu puonzâr sâwm, puonzaiin- hmi kawp, sahmul dumpâwl le a êm le a seninlârin, kutthiemtaka siem cherubhai lim leh i siem ding a nih.

en: The length of each curtain shall be eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: all the curtains shall have one measure.
hmr: Puonzâr tin seitieng chu tawng sawmhni pariet, puonzâr tin lien- tieng chu tawng li nîng a tih; puonzâr po po chu intie seng an ni ding a nih.

en: Five curtains shall be coupled together one to another; and the other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.
hmr: Puonzâr panga chu ṭhui zawm vawng ding a na, a dang panga khawm chu ṭhui zawm vawng ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling; and likewise shalt thou make in the edge of the curtain that is outmost in the second coupling.
hmr: Puonzâr pakhat a thuo laia kâwlhnung tak tlânga chun valbahai dumpâwlin siem i ta, chuong ang bawkin a zawm hninaa puonzâr puo tak tlânga chun siem bawk i tih.

en: Fifty loops shalt thou make in the one curtain, and fifty loops shalt thou make in the edge of the curtain that is in the second coupling; the loops shall be opposite one to another.
hmr: Puonzâr pakhata chun valba sâwmnga siem i ta, chun, a zawm hninaa puonzâr tlânga chun valba sâwmnga bawk siem i tih; valbahai chu an inzawm seng ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make fifty clasps of gold, and couple the curtains one to another with the clasps: and the tabernacle shall be one whole.
hmr: Rângkachakin puonchepna sâwm- nga siem i ta, puonchepnahai chun puonzârhai chu chepdêng i ta; biekbûk chu pakhat hung nîng a tih.

en: And thou shalt make curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains shalt thou make them.
hmr: Biekbûk chunga inkhumna ding- in kêl hmul puonzârhai siem i ta, puonzâr chu sâwm le pakhat siem i tih.

en: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: the eleven curtains shall have one measure.
hmr: Puonzâr tin seitieng chu tawng sâwmthum, puonzâr tin lientieng chu tawng li nîng a tih: puonzârhai sawm le pakhat chu intie seng an ni ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and shalt double over the sixth curtain in the forefront of the tent.
hmr: Puonzârhai panga chu anni le anni ṭhui zawm i ta, puonzârhai paruk chu anni le anni ṭhui zawm bawk i ta, puon in tuoltienga chun puonzâr parukna chu thlep i tih.

en: And thou shalt make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain that is outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops upon the edge of the curtain which is outmost in the second coupling.
hmr: A thuo hmasaa puonzâr kâwl- hnung tak tlânga chun valba sâwmnga siem i ta, chun, a thuo hninaa puonzâr kâwlhnung tak tlânga chun valba sâwmnga bawk siem i tih.

en: And thou shalt make fifty clasps of brass, and put the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.
hmr: “Chun, dârsenin puonchepna sâwmnga siem i ta, puonchepnahai chu valbahai sûnga chun thun i ta, puonzârhai chu pakhat an ni theina dingin chelmat a tih.

en: And the overhanging part that remaineth of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remaineth, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.
hmr: Puon in puonzârhaia chung inkhum tâwk bâk, puonzâr chenve la chuong kaithla chu biekbûk châwr- tieng chun inzâr a tih.

en: And the cubit on the one side, and the cubit on the other side, of that which remaineth in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.
hmr: Sîr khingah tawng khat, sîr dangah tawng khat bawk puon in inkhumna puonzârhai lienziea la chuong chu, biekbûk hitieng sîr le sawtieng sîr zuk inkhum dingin inzâr ve vêng a tih.

en: And thou shalt make a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of sealskins above.
hmr: Chun, chu bûk chung inkhumna ding chun berâmchal vun suksenhai siem i ta, chu chunga chun a chung inkhumna seal vunhai siem bawk i tih.

en: And thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up.
hmr: “Chun, biekbûk bang chu shit- tim thingphêk intungin siem i tih.

en: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board.
hmr: Thingphêk seizie chu tawng sâwm nîng a ta, thingphêk tin lien- tieng chu tawng khat le a chenve nîng a tih.

en: Two tenons shall there be in each board, joined one to another: thus shalt thou make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
hmr: Thingphêk tina chun a rek pahni, a dang le sukzawmna ding um seng a ta, biekbûk thingphêkhai po po chu chuong ang seng chun i siem ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side southward.
hmr: Chun, biekbûk ding thingphêk- hai chu simsawngah thingphêk sâwmhni siem i tih.

en: And thou shalt make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons:
hmr: Thingphêk sâwmhni hnuoia chun tangkaraw kerkuokhai sâwmli siem i ta, thingphêk pakhat hnuoia a rêkhai pahni inṭhutna dingin ker- kuok pahni, thingphêk dang hnuoia a rek pahniha dingin kerkuok pahni bawk siem i tih.

en: and for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, twenty boards,
hmr: “Chun, biekbûk sîr khingtieng, hmartieng panga chun thingphêk sawmhni,

en: and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
hmr: le tangkaraw kerkuok sâwmli, thingphêk pakhat hnuoiah kerkuok pahni, thingphêk dang hnuoiah kerkuok pahni pei bawk siem i tih.

en: And for the hinder part of the tabernacle westward thou shalt make six boards.
hmr: Biekbûk chawrtieng pang, thlangtieng panga chun thingphêk paruk siem i tih.

en: And two boards shalt thou make for the corners of the tabernacle in the hinder part.
hmr: A chawrtieng panga biekbûk kihaia dingin thingphêk pahni bawk siem i tih.

en: And they shall be double beneath, and in like manner they shall be entire unto the top thereof unto one ring: thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.
hmr: A hnuoitieng chun suktuok nîng an ta, chuong ang bawk chun a chungtieng khawm a sîpa chun kuol pakhata chelkhâwm nîng an tih; a kiha thingphêkhai pahni chu chuong anga chu siem ding a nih.

en: And there shall be eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
hmr: Chun, thingphêk pariet le tangkaraw kerkuok, kerkuok sâwm le paruk, thingphêk pakhat hnuoiah kerkuok pahni, thingphêk dang hnuoiah kerkuok pahni pei ning a tih.

en: And thou shalt make bars of acacia wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
hmr: Chun, shittim thing bangruhai siem i tih: biekbûk sîr khat tienga thingphêkhaia dingin panga,

en: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the hinder part westward.
hmr: biekbûk sîr khingtienga thing- phêkhaia dingin panga; chun biekbûk hnungtienga thlangtieng panga thingphêkhaia dingin panga bawk.

en: And the middle bar in the midst of the boards shall pass through from end to end.
hmr: A bangru lailung thingphêkhai a lai taka mi chu a tâwpa inthawka a tâwp khingtieng chena rawl thleng zar a ni ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt overlay the boards with gold, and make their rings of gold for places for the bars: and thou shalt overlay the bars with gold.
hmr: Chun, thingphêkhai chu râng- kachakin inluon khum i ta, bang- ruhai thunna ding chun rângkachak kuolhai siem bawk i tih; chun, bangruhai khawm chu rângkachakin inluon khum i tih.

en: And thou shalt rear up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which hath been showed thee in the mount.
hmr: Chun, biekbûk chu tlânga a riruot inhmutir i ni ang dan peiin în ngîr ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make a veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim the work of the skilful workman shall it be made:
hmr: “Chun puonzâr sahmul dum- pâwl, a êm le seninlâr le pat zai inhmi-kawpin siem i ta, cherubhai lim kutthiemtaka siem haia cheia siem ding a nih:

en: and thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold; their hooks shall be of gold, upon four sockets of silver.
hmr: chun rângkachaka inluon khum, tangkaraw kerkuokhaia in- ṭhut, shittim ban palia rângkachak kuoikimhaia chun i khai ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt hang up the veil under the clasps, and shalt bring in thither within the veil the ark of the testimony: and the veil shall separate unto you between the holy place and the most holy.
hmr: Puonzâr chu puonchepnahaiin khai i ta, puonzâr sûngtienga chun Thuthlung bâwm chu hung lâng i ta, chuongchun, puonzâr chun Hmun Inthieng le Hmun Inthiengtak chu ṭhepêk a ti che.

en: And thou shalt put the mercy-seat upon the ark of the testimony in the most holy place.
hmr: Hmun Inthieng taka chun Zângaina ṭhungpha chu Thuthlung bâwm chunga chun sieng i tih.

en: And thou shalt set the table without the veil, and the candlestick over against the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south: and thou shalt put the table on the north side.
hmr: Puonzâr puoa chun dawkân chu sieng i ta, khâwnvar siena chu dawkân zâwn Biekbûk simtieng pangah; chun, dawkân chu hmar- tieng pangah i sie ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make a screen for the door of the Tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer.
hmr: Puon in kawtkhâr ding chun puonzâr, puon zai inhmi kawp le sahmul dumpâwl, a êm le seninlâr, puon ṭhuimawi thiemtaka ṭhui chu i siem ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make for the screen five pillars of acacia, and overlay them with gold: their hooks shall be of gold: and thou shalt cast five sockets of brass for them.
hmr: Puonzâr khaina ding chun shittim ban panga siem la, rângka- chakin inluonkhum rawh; an kuoikimhai chu rângkachak a ni ding a na, dârsen kerkuok panga i sutpêk bawk ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and the height thereof shall be three cubits.
hmr: “Shittim thing mâichâm tawng ngaa sei, tawng ngaa lien i siem ding a na, chu mâichâm chu kil li nei, tawng thuma insâng a ni ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make the horns of it upon the four corners thereof; the horns thereof shall be of one piece with it: and thou shalt overlay it with brass.
hmr: A kil pali chunga chun kihai siem i ta, chu kihai chu ama le chun zawm khat an ni ding a nih; dârsenin inluon khum bawk i tih.

en: And thou shalt make its pots to take away its ashes, and its shovels, and its basins, and its flesh-hooks, and its firepans: all the vessels thereof thou shalt make of brass.
hmr: A vut dawna dingin bêlhai siem i ta, meikhelnahai, châwtawlhai, thîr- kuoihai le vutluohai siem i ta; a hmangruohai po po chu dârsena siem a ni ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make for it a grating of network of brass: and upon the net shalt thou make four brazen rings in the four corners thereof.
hmr: Chu ta ding chun dârsen inphan thuk siem bawk i ta; chun, a lên kil palia chun dârsen kuol pali siem i tih.

en: And thou shalt put it under the ledge round the altar beneath, that the net may reach halfway up the altar.
hmr: A lên chu mâichâm inchenna zu tlung dingin mâichâm rei hnuoi zar zarah sieng i tih.

en: And thou shalt make staves for the altar, staves of acacia wood, and overlay them with brass.
hmr: Mâichâm zâwnna ding chun zâwnfunghai shittim thingin siem i ta, dârsen inluon khum i tih.

en: And the staves thereof shall be put into the rings, and the staves shall be upon the two sides of the altar, in bearing it.
hmr: Zâwnfunghai chu dârsen kuolhai sûnga chun rawl ding a nih, hang zâwn zâwngin zâwnfunghai chu mâichâm sîr hnia chun um an tih.

en: Hollow with planks shalt thou make it: as it hath been showed thee in the mount, so shall they make it.
hmr: Thingphêkhaiin mâichâm chu a kawrawngin i siem ding a nih, tlânga inhmutir i ni ang tak khan siem a ni ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt make the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward there shall be hangings for the court of fine twined linen a hundred cubits long for one side:
hmr: “Biekbûk tuolzâwl chu i siem ding a na; a simtieng pang tuolzâwla dinga puonzârhai chu puon zai inhmi kawp, sîr khata dinga tawng za khat a ni ding a nih.

en: and the pillars thereof shall be twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.
hmr: A ban chu sâwmhni le a kerkuok sâwmhni dârsena siem nîng a ta, ban kuoikimhai le a tuommawinahai chu tangkaruo a ni ding a nih.
