en: And these are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari; and the years of the life of Levi were a hundred thirty and seven years.
hmr: Levi naupasalhai hming chu an thlatuhai chanchin suina ang peiin hieng ang hi a nih: Gerson, Kohath le Merari hi; chun Levi dam sûng kumhai chu kum za khat le sawm- thum pasari a nih.

en: The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei, according to their families.
hmr: An sûngkuo ang peia Gerson naupasalhai chu Libni le Simei.

en: And the sons of Kohath: Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel; and the years of the life of Kohath were a hundred thirty and three years.
hmr: Kohath naupasalhai chu Amram, Izhar, Hebron le Uzziel. Kohath dam sûng kumhai chu kum zakhat le sawmthum pathum a nih.

en: And the sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their generations.
hmr: Merari naupasalhai chu Mahli le Musi. Hieng hi an inthla dân suina ang peia Levi mi sûngkuohai chu an nih.

en: And Amram took him Jochebed his father’s sister to wife; and she bare him Aaron and Moses: and the years of the life of Amram were a hundred and thirty and seven years.
hmr: Amram hin a pa farnu Jokebed chu nuhmeiin a nei a; ama chun Aron le Mosie a neipêk a. Amram dam sûng kumhai chu kum za khat le sawmthum pasari a nih.

en: And the sons of Izhar: Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
hmr: Izhar naupasalhai chu: Kora, Nepheg le Zikri.

en: And the sons of Uzziel: Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Sithri.
hmr: Uzziel naupasalhai chu: Misael le Elzaphan le Sithri.

en: And Aaron took him Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab, the sister of Nahshon, to wife; and she bare him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
hmr: Aron chun Amminadab naunu, Nason farnu, Eliseba chu nuhmeiin a nei a; ama chun Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar le Ithamar a neipêk a.

en: And the sons of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korahites.
hmr: Kora naupasalhai chu Assir, Elkana le, Abiasaph; hieng hi Kora sûngkuohai chu an nih.

en: And Eleazar Aaron’s son took him one of the daughters of Putiel to wife; and she bare him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites according to their families.
hmr: Aron naupa Eleazar chun Putiel naunuhmei pakhat chu nuhmeiin a nei a, ama chun Phinehas a neipêk a. An sûngkuohai ang peiin, hieng hi Levi mihai pahnam tin luhai chu an nih.

en: These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom Jehovah said, Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their hosts.
hmr: Hieng hi an nih Mosie le Aron kuoma LALPAIN, “Israel thlahai chu Aigupta rama inthawkin an pâwl ruol ang peiin hung ṭhuoi suok ro,” a tihai chu.

en: These are they that spake to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt: these are that Moses and Aaron.
hmr: Hi Aron le hi Mosie hi an nih Aigupta lal Pharao kuoma Israel thlahai Aiguptaa inthawka ṭhuoi suok dinga hriltuhai chu.

en: And it came to pass on the day when Jehovah spake unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
hmr: Aigupta rama LALPAIN Mosie kuoma thu a hril ni chun,

en: that Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying, I am Jehovah: speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I speak unto thee.
hmr: LALPAIN Mosie kuomah, “Kei LALPA chu ka nih; i kuoma thu ka hril po po hi Aigupta lal Pharao kuomah hril rawh,” tiin, a hril tah a.

en: And Moses said before Jehovah, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?
hmr: Mosie chun LALPA kuomah, “Ngai ta, kei chu hmûr themthiem- lotak ka nih a, Pharao chun iengtin am ka thu ngai a ti leh?” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, See, I have made thee as God to Pharaoh; and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Mosie kuomah, “En ta, Pharao kuoma chun Pathien angah ka siem cheh a; chun, i unaupa Aron chu i zâwlnei nîng a tih.

en: Thou shalt speak all that I command thee; and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
hmr: Thu ka pêk po po che kha nangin hril i ta: chun, i unaupa Aron chun, a rama inthawka Israel thlahai chu infe suoktir dingin Pharao kuomah hril vêng a tih.

en: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pharao lungril chu sukngar ka ta, Aigupta rama chun ka thilmakhai le ka inchiknahai chu sukpung ka tih.

en: But Pharaoh will not hearken unto you, and I will lay my hand upon Egypt, and bring forth my hosts, my people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
hmr: Pharao chun in thu chu ngai naw nih a, chuongchun, Aigupta chunga chun ka kut thlâk ka ta, ka mipuihai, ka mi Israel thlahai chu, rorêlna nasatakhai hmangin Aigupta rama inthawkin ṭhuoi suok ka tih.

en: And the Egyptians shall know that I am Jehovah, when I stretch forth my hand upon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.
hmr: Aigupta chunga chun ka bân ka phar a, Israel thlahai chu anni laia inthawk ngeia ka ṭhuoi suok pha chun, Aigupta mihai chun LALPA ka ni ti mi hre tâng an tih,” a tih a.

en: And Moses and Aaron did so; as Jehovah commanded them, so did they.
hmr: Chun, Mosie le Aron chun LALPAIN an kuoma thu a pêk ang tak chun an thaw tah a.

en: And Moses was fourscore years old, and Aaron fourscore and three years old, when they spake unto Pharaoh.
hmr: Pharao kuoma thu an hril lai hin Mosie chu kum sawmriet mi a nih a, Aron chu kum sawmriet pathum mi a nih.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie le Aron kuoma chun,

en: When Pharaoh shall speak unto you, saying, Show a wonder for you; then thou shalt say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast it down before Pharaoh, that it become a serpent.
hmr: “Pharao chun, ‘Thilmak chu hang inentir ta u le,’ a ti pha cheu chun, Aron kuomah, ‘I hmawl la la, Pharao hmaah pei thla rawh,’ tîng i ta; chun, rûlin inchang a tih,” a tih a.

en: And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and they did so, as Jehovah had commanded: and Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
hmr: Chun, Mosie le Aron chu Pharao kuoma chun an va lût a, LALPAIN thu a pêk ang tak chun an thaw tah a: Aron chun Pharao le a siehlawhai hmaa chun a hmawl chu a pei thlâk a, rûlin a hung inchang tah a.

en: Then Pharaoh also called for the wise men and the sorcerers: and they also, the magicians of Egypt, did in like manner with their enchantments.
hmr: Chun, Pharao khawmin mi varhai le dawithiemhai a ko khâwm a, Aigupta aisânthiemhai khawm chun dawi hmangin chuong ang tak chun an thaw ve tah a.

en: For they cast down every man his rod, and they became serpents: but Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
hmr: Mi tin chun an hmawl chu an pei thlâk a, rûlah ân chang seng a, nisienlakhawm, Aron hmawl chun an hmawlhai chu a lem tah a.

en: And Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as Jehovah had spoken.
hmr: Pharao lungril chu sukngarin a um a, LALPAIN a hril ang khan an thu chu a ngai nawh a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Pharaoh’s heart is stubborn, he refuseth to let the people go.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Pharao lungril chu sukngar a nih a, mipuihai chu ân fetir phal nawh.

en: Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out unto the water; and thou shalt stand by the river’s brink to meet him; and the rod which was turned to a serpent shalt thou take in thy hand.
hmr: Pharao kuomah zîngkâr va fe la, tui tienga a fe laiin ama intuokpui dingin vadung panga chun ngîr la; chun, hmawl rûla inchang kha i kutin chawi rawh.

en: And thou shalt say unto him, Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, hath sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness: and, behold, hitherto thou hast not hearkened.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah, ‘LALPA, Hebraihai Pathien chun, Ka mihaiin ka rawng an bâwl theina dingin thlalerah infetir rawh, tiin i kuomah a mi hung tir a nih, ngai ta, chu chu i ngai si nawh a.

en: Thus saith Jehovah, In this thou shalt know that I am Jehovah: behold, I will smite with the rod that is in my hand upon the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
hmr: Hieng hin LALPAIN a tih, Hitaka hin LALPA ka ni mi hrieng i tih, ngai ta, ka kuta hmawl um hin vadunga tuihai hi zuk vuong ka ta, thisenah inchang an tih.

en: And the fish that are in the river shall die, and the river shall become foul; and the Egyptians shall loathe to drink water from the river.
hmr: Chun, vadunga nga umhai chu thîng an ta, vadung chu a thûkin thûng a tih; chun, Aigupta mihai chun vadunga tui chu dâwn dingin tirdak an tih,’ ti rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thy hand over the waters of Egypt, over their rivers, over their streams, and over their pools, and over all their ponds of water, that they may become blood; and there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Aron kuomah, ‘I hmawl la la, Aiguptaa tui po po an vadunghai chungah, an tuiluongnahai chungah le, an dîlhai chungah le, an tuitinghai chunga chun i kut phar rawh, thisen an hung ni theina dingin; chun, Aigupta ram sûng po poa thing tuibêlhai le lung tuibêlhaia khawm chun thisen hung nîng an tih,’ tiin hril rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Moses and Aaron did so, as Jehovah commanded; and he lifted up the rod, and smote the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
hmr: Mosie le Aron chun LALPA thupêk ang tak chun an thaw tah a. Aron chun a hmawl chu ân let a, Pharao le a siehlawhai mithmu ngeia chun vadunga tui chu a vuok a, vadunga tui po po chu thisenah a hung inchang ta vawng a.

en: And the fish that were in the river died; and the river became foul, and the Egyptians could not drink water from the river; and the blood was throughout all the land of Egypt.
hmr: Vadunga nga umhai chu an thi tah a; chun, vadung chu a thûkin a thu tah a, Aigupta mihai chun vadunga tui chu an dâwn thei ta nawh a: Aigupta ram sûng po poah thisen chu a um sih a.

en: And the magicians of Egypt did in like manner with their enchantments: and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as Jehovah had spoken.
hmr: Chun, Aiguptaa aisânthiemhai khawm chun dawi hmangin chuong ang tak chun an thaw veh a. Pharao lungril chu sukngarin a um zing a, LALPAIN a hril ta ang khan an thu chu a ngai nawh a.

en: And Pharaoh turned and went into his house, neither did he lay even this to heart.
hmr: Pharao chu a kîr a, a inah a fe tah a, a lungrilah hi thu hi a ngaituo bawk nawh.

en: And all the Egyptians digged round about the river for water to drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river.
hmr: Aigupta mihai po po chun vadung vêla chun tui dâwn ding hmu tumin an cho tah a; vadung tui chu an dâwn thei ta si nawh a.

en: And seven days were fulfilled, after that Jehovah had smitten the river.
hmr: LALPAIN vadung a vuok chenah ni sari a liem tah a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Mosie kuomah, “Pharao kuomah va fe la, a kuomah, ‘Hieng hin LALPÂN a tih; Ka rawng an bâwl theina dingin ka mihai infetir rawh.

en: And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:
hmr: Anni infetir i phal naw chun, ngai rawh, i ram sûng po po uṭawk haiin ka hung hrem ding a nih.

en: and the river shall swarm with frogs, which shall go up and come into thy house, and into thy bedchamber, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thine ovens, and into thy kneading-troughs:
hmr: Vadung chu uṭawkhaiin sip an ta, chuong chu hung suok an ta, i in sûnga dâm, i khum pindan sûnga dâm, i khum chunga dâm, i siehlaw- hai in sûnga dâm, i mihai chunga dâm, i thuk sûnga dâm, i bei siemna thuk sûnga dâm hung lût an tih.

en: and the frogs shall come up both upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon all thy servants.
hmr: Chuong uṭawkhai chu nanga chunga le i mihai chunga le, i siehlawhai chungah hung ṭuong seng an tih,’ tiin hril rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch forth thy hand with thy rod over the rivers, over the streams, and over the pools, and cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Mosie kuomah, “Aron kuoma chun, ‘Vadunghai, tuiluongnahai le dîlhai chungah i kuta i hmawl chu inlet la,Aigupta ram chungah uṭawkhai hung suok raw hai se,’ ti rawh,” a ta.

en: And Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt; and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Aron chun Aiguptaa tuihai chunga chun a bân a phar a, uṭawk- hai chu an hung suok a, Aigupta ram chu an dâp ta vawng a.

en: And the magicians did in like manner with their enchantments, and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, aisânthiemhai khawm chun an dawi hmangin chuong ang tak chun an thawh a, Aigupta ram chunga chun uṭawkhai chu an hung suok veh a.

en: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Entreat Jehovah, that he take away the frogs from me, and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may sacrifice unto Jehovah.
hmr: Pharao chun Mosie le Aron a ko a, “LALPA chu ngên ro, ka mihai le ka kuoma inthawkin uṭawkhai hi la hmang sienla; chun, LALPA kuoma an inthâwi theina dingin mipui chu infetir ka tih,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said unto Pharaoh, Have thou this glory over me: against what time shall I entreat for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, that the frogs be destroyed from thee and thy houses, and remain in the river only?
hmr: Mosie chun Pharao kuomah, “Nangma le i ina uṭawkhai chu sukbohmanga vadunga bak chun um zing dingin i mihai le i siehlawhai le nanga ta dingin iengtik am ka ngên pêk ding cheu lunginsiettakin mi hril rawh,” a tih a.

en: And he said, Against to-morrow. And he said, Be it according to thy word; that thou mayest know that there is none like unto Jehovah our God.
hmr: Ama chun, “Zînga leh,” a tih a. Ama chun, “I thu ang peiin ni raw se: LALPA kan Pathien ang hi mi tu- khawm an um nawh ti i hriet theina dingin.

en: And the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people; they shall remain in the river only.
hmr: Uṭawkhai chu i mihai le i sie- hlawhai le i in le nangmaa inthawkin fe hmang an ta, vadunga bak um tâng an tih,” a tih a.

en: And Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh: and Moses cried unto Jehovah concerning the frogs which he had brought upon Pharaoh.
hmr: Chun, Mosie le Aron chu Pharao kuoma inthawk chu an fe suok tah a: chun, Mosie chun Pharao chunga uṭawkhai a hung suksuok thua chun LALPA chu a ko tah a.

en: And Jehovah did according to the word of Moses; and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the courts, and out of the fields.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie thu ang ngei chun a hung thawh a; lohai, khuohai le, inhaia uṭawkhai chu an thi hmang vawng tah a.

en: And they gathered them together in heaps; and the land stank.
hmr: A bûm bûmin an inkhâwm a, ram chu a thûkin a thu a.

en: But when Pharaoh saw that there was respite, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not unto them, as Jehovah had spoken.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pharao chun chuong chu a bo tah ti a hriet chun, a lungril a sukngar a; LALPAIN a lo hril ta ang ngei khan an thu chu a ngai nawh a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the earth, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
hmr: LALPAIN Mosie kuomah, “Aron kuoma chun, ‘I hmawl kha inlet la, hnuoi chunga pilvut chu vaw rawh, Aigupta ram po poah hrikhai an hung ni theina dingin,’ ti rawh,” a tih a.

en: And they did so; and Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth, and there were lice upon man, and upon beast; all the dust of the earth became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chuong ang tak chun an thawh a, Aron chun a kuta hmawl chu ân let a, hnuoia pilvut chu a vuok a, sa le mihriem chunga chun hrikhai an hung um tah a; Aigupta ram po poa chun pilvut chu hrikin a hung inchang vawng tah a.

en: And the magicians did so with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not: and there were lice upon man, and upon beast.
hmr: Aisânthiemhai chun an dâwi hmangin hrikhai suksuok dingin an thaw veh a, nisienlakhawm, an thei nawh a. Chuongchun, sa le mihriem chunga chun hrikhai chu an um tah a.

en: Then the magicians said unto Pharaoh, This is the finger of God: and Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as Jehovah had spoken.
hmr: Aisânthiemhai chun Pharao kuomah, “Hi hi Pathien kutpâr a nih,” an tih a. Pharao lungril ruok chu sukngarin a um a, LALPAIN a lo hril ta ang ngei khan, an thu chu a ngai chuong nawh.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; lo, he cometh forth to the water; and say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Zîngkâr tho la, Pharao chu tui tienga a fe lai chu lo nghâk la, a kuomah, ‘LALPAIN hieng hin a tih, ka rawng an bawl theina dingin ka mihai infetir rawh.

en: Else, if thou wilt not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.
hmr: Chuong ni loa, ka mihai în fetir naw chun nang le i siehlawhai le i mihai chunga le, i in sûnga le, Aigupta mihai inhai le an umna leihnuoi po poa chun tho ruolpui hung tir ka tih.

en: And I will set apart in that day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there; to the end thou mayest know that I am Jehovah in the midst of the earth.
hmr: Chu ni chun ka mihai umna Gosen ram chu suktum ka ta, tho ruol hrim um der naw ni hai, hnuoi chunga hin kei LALPA ka nih ti i hriet theina dingin.

en: And I will put a division between my people and thy people: by to-morrow shall this sign be.
hmr: Chuong ang chun i mihai le ka mihai inkârah thlierhranna nei ka tih; chu inchikna chu zîngah hung tlung a tih,’ ti rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah did so; and there came grievous swarms of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants’ houses: and in all the land of Egypt the land was corrupted by reason of the swarms of flies.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun chuong ang chun a hung thaw tah a. Pharao in sûnga le a siehlawhai inhai sûnga chun thohai râpthlâktakin an hung a: chuong thohai lei chun Aigupta ram sung po poah ram chu suksietin a um tah a.

en: And Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron, and said, Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land.
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun Mosie le Aron chu a ko a, “Fe unla, hi ram sûnga hin in Pathien kuoma chun inthâwi ro,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said, It is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to Jehovah our God: lo, shall we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, and will they not stone us?
hmr: Mosie chun, “Chuong anga thaw chu rem thei naw nih. Kan Pathien LALPA kuoma kan inthâwinaa chun Aigupta mihai tirdak zâwng inhlân ding kan ni sih a. Aigupta mihai tirdak zâwng chu an mithmu ngeia kan inhlân chun lungin an mi dêng naw ding am a nih?

en: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to Jehovah our God, as he shall command us.
hmr: Thu a mi pêk angin, thlalêrah ni thum lama hlaah fêng kan ta, LALPA kan Pathien kuoma chun inthâwi kan tih,” a tih a.

en: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to Jehovah your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.
hmr: Pharao chun, “LALPA in Pathien kuoma chun thlalêra in inthâwi theina dingin infetir ka ti cheu, amiruokchu, hlatakah fe naw unla, ka ta ding khawmin mi ngênpêk rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said, Behold, I go out from thee, and I will entreat Jehovah that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, to-morrow: only let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to Jehovah.
hmr: Mosie chun, “I kuoma inthawk- in fe suok ka ta, Pharao le a sie- hlawhai le a mihaia inthawka, thohai hi zînga inthawka an fe hmangna dingin LALPA chu hnîng ka tih; amiruokchu, mipuihai chu LALPA kuoma inthâwi dinga infetir loin hmusittakin Pharao hin sawisa lep ta naw phawt raw se,” a tih a.

en: And Moses went out from Pharaoh, and entreated Jehovah.
hmr: Mosie chu Pharao kuoma inthawk chun a suok a, LALPA chu a ngên tah a.

en: And Jehovah did according to the word of Moses; and he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people; there remained not one.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie thu ang pei chun a thawh a; Pharao le a siehlawhai le a mihaia inthawkin thohai chu a lâk hmang vawng a, pakhat khawm a um ta nawh a.

en: And Pharaoh hardened his heart this time also, and he did not let the people go.
hmr: Hi ṭum khawm hin Pharao chun a lungril a sukngar a, mipui chu ân fetir chuong naw nâwk a.

en: Then Jehovah said unto Moses, Go in unto Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Mosie kuom- ah, “Pharao kuomah fe la, ‘LALPA, Hebraihai Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: ka rawng an bâwl theina dingin ka mihai infetir rawh.

en: For if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still,
hmr: Anni chu infetir i phal nawha, i khuokhir zing chun,

en: behold, the hand of Jehovah is upon thy cattle which are in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the herds, and upon the flocks: there shall be a very grievous murrain.
hmr: ngai rawh, loa i ran ruol umhai, sakawrhai, sabengtunghai, sa- nghâwngseihai, bâwng ruolhai le, berâm ruolhai chungah LALPA kut chu hri râpthlâktak leh tlâng a tih.

en: And Jehovah shall make a distinction between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt; and there shall nothing die of all that belongeth to the children of Israel.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, Aigupta mihai le Israelhai ran ruolhai thlier a ta, Israel thlahai ta taphawt chu iengkhawm thi naw tawp an tih, a tih,’ tiin hril rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah appointed a set time, saying, To-morrow Jehovah shall do this thing in the land.
hmr: LALPA chun hun bîk a ruot a, “Hi thil hi, hi rama hin zîngah LALPAIN thawng a tih,” a tih a.

en: And Jehovah did that thing on the morrow; and all the cattle of Egypt died; but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
hmr: A zînga chun chu thil chu LALPA chun a thaw tah a. Aigupta mihai ran ruol po po chu an thi vawng a, Israel thlahai ran ruol ruok chu pakhat khawm an thi nawh a.

en: And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not so much as one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. But the heart of Pharaoh was stubborn, and he did not let the people go.
hmr: Pharao chun mi a tir a, Israel thlahai ran ruol chu pakhat khawm an thi dêr nawh ti a hriet a. Nisienlakhawm, Pharao lungril chu a ngar a, mihai chu ân fetir chuong nawh.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses and unto Aaron, Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie le Aron kuoma chun, “Thuka vut kut sipin chawi unla, Pharao mithmu ngeiah Mosiein vân tieng vawr raw se.

en: And it shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon man and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta ram chung po poah pilvut indi takah inchang a ta, Aigupta ram sûng po povah mihriem le ran chungah khuoihli invûngin inchang a tih,” a tih a.

en: And they took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it up toward heaven; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon man and upon beast.
hmr: Chun, thuka vut chu an lâk a, Pharao hmaa chun an ngir a; Mosie chun vân tieng chun a vawr tah a, chuongchun, mihriem le ran chunga chun khuoihli invûngah ân chang tah a.

en: And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boils were upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.
hmr: Chun, khuoihlihai lei chun aisânthiemhai chu Mosie hmaa chun an ngîr thei ta nawh a; chu khuoihli chu Aigupta mihai po po le aisân- thiemhai chunga khawm a um seng sih a.

en: And Jehovah hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them, as Jehovah had spoken unto Moses.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Pharao lungril chu a sukngar a, LALPAIN Mosie kuoma a hril ta angin an thu hril chu a ngai chuong nawh a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie kuomah, “Zîngkâr inhmatakin tho la, Pharao hmaah ngîr la, a kuomah, ‘Hebraihai Pathien LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ka rawng an bâwl theina dingin ka mihai infetir rawh.

en: For I will this time send all my plagues upon thy heart, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people; that thou mayest know that there is none like me in all the earth.
hmr: Hnuoi chung po poah keima ang tukhawm an um nawh ti i hriet theina dingin, tuta ṭum hin chu, i mihai le i siehlawhai le nangma chunga ngei ka hri po po ka hung tir ding a ni sih a.

en: For now I had put forth my hand, and smitten thee and thy people with pestilence, and thou hadst been cut off from the earth:
hmr: Tuhin ka kut inlet ka ta, i mihai le nang ngei chu hripuiin hrem ka ti cheu a, hnuoia inthawka sâtthlâk ni tâng i tih:

en: but in very deed for this cause have I made thee to stand, to show thee my power, and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, hi thilthaw kawng ngeihaia hin ka thilthawthei- nahai chu nangmaa inentir a ni theina ding le khawvêl po poa ka hming chu phuongdar a ni theina dingin ka la dawmngir zing che a ni hi.

en: As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people, that thou wilt not let them go?
hmr: Ka mihai chunga hin nang le nang inchawimawiin, anni chu i lân fetir naw rawp ding a ni maw?

en: Behold, to-morrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since the day it was founded even until now.
hmr: Ngai rawh, zîngah tu pha ngei hin riel nasa râpthlâk insûrtir ka ta; chuong ang hrim hrim chu Aigup- taah, hi ram um hlima inthawk tu chen hin a la um ngai dêr nawh.

en: Now therefore send, hasten in thy cattle and all that thou hast in the field; for every man and beast that shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.
hmr: Chuleiin, tuhin mi tir la, i ran ruol le loa i thil nei po po chu inhulah hung la lût vak raw hai se; mi tin le ran loa um taphawthai, ina hung lâk lût nawhai chungah riel chu a hung sûr ding a ni sih a, an thi vawng ding a nih, a tih,’ tiin hril rawh,” a tih a.

en: He that feared the word of Jehovah among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses:
hmr: Pharao siehlawhai laia LALPA thu ṭitu chun a siehlawhai le a ran ruol chu inahai ân tlân lûttir a;

en: and he that regarded not the word of Jehovah left his servants and his cattle in the field.
hmr: LALPA thu ngaisaknawtu ruok chun a siehlawhai le ran ruol chu loah ân umtir a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Moses, Stretch forth thy hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Mosie kuom- ah, “Aigupta ram sûng po poa, mihriem le ran le loa thlai tinrêng chungah, Aigupta ram po poah riel nasatak a hung sûr theina dingin, vân tieng i kut phar rawh,” a tih a.

en: And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven: and Jehovah sent thunder and hail, and fire ran down unto the earth; and Jehovah rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
hmr: Chun, Mosie chun a hmawl chu vân tieng ân let a; chuongchun, LALPA chun vâninrûm le riel chu a hung tir tah a, hnuoia chun mei dâm a zuk tlah a, LALPA chun Aigupta ram chunga chun riel ân sûrtir tah a.

en: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as had not been in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
hmr: Chuongchun, riel, ṭêktla le riel inpawl, râpthlâktak el, Aigupta ram po poah, hnam a hung ni chena inthawka la hmu ngai dêr lo chu a hung tlung tah a.

en: And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail smote every herb of the field, and brake every tree of the field.
hmr: Aigupta ram po poa, loa thil um taphawt chu mihriem le ran khawm a dêng hlum ta vawng a; riel chun loa thlaihna tinrêng chu a dêng hlumin, rama thinghai khawm chu a dêng thliek bawk a.

en: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.
hmr: Israel thlahai umna Gosen rama bak chun riel chu a tla ve nawh a.

en: And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them, I have sinned this time: Jehovah is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
hmr: Chun, Pharao chun mi a tir a, Aron le Mosie chu ân kotir a, an kuomah, “Tuta ṭum chu ka lo suol takzet a nih, ka mihai le kei chu kan khawhlo a, LALPA ruok chu a fel a nih.

en: Entreat Jehovah; for there hath been enough of these mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.
hmr: Hun ta raw se, riel le vâninrûm ri nasatakhai hi a bona dingin LALPA chu hni la, chuongchun, infetir ka ti cheu, um ta hrim hrim naw ti niu,” a tih a.

en: And Moses said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands unto Jehovah; the thunders shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know that the earth is Jehovah’s.
hmr: Mosie chun a kuomah, “Khaw- pui hi ka suoksan phingleh, LALPA tieng ka kut phar ka ta, hnuoi hi LALPA ta a nih ti i hriet theina dingin, vâninrûmhai chu mâng a ta; riel hrim khawm um nâwk ta dêr naw nih.

en: But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear Jehovah God.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nang le i sie- hlawhai chun, LALPA Pathien chu la ṭi chuong naw ti niu ti ka hriet a nih,” a tih a.

en: And the flax and the barley were smitten: for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in bloom.
hmr: Ziza le buṭei chu dêng hlumin an um a, buṭei chu a vui tahin ziza khawm chu a pâr lai tak a ni sih a.

en: But the wheat and the spelt were not smitten: for they were not grown up.
hmr: Bupui le mîm ruok chu dêng siet an ni ve nawh a, an puitling inhnu leiin.

en: And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread abroad his hands unto Jehovah: and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
hmr: Mosie chu Pharao kuoma inthawka khawpui puoha a suok chun, LALPA kuom tieng a kut chu a phar tah a; chun, vâninrûmhai le riel chu a ma tah a, hnuoi chunga chun ruo khawm a sûr ta nawh a.

en: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
hmr: Pharao chun ruo le riel le vâninrûmhai chu a ma tah ti a hmu chun, a la suksuol ta rawp a, ama le a siehlawhai khawm chun an lungril chu an la sukngar ta rawp a.

en: And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the children of Israel go, as Jehovah had spoken by Moses.
hmr: Pharao lungril chu sukngarin a um a, Mosie baua LALPAIN a lo hril ta angin, ama chun Israel thlahai chu ân fetir nuom nawh a.
